Name: Analyst
Description: We are actively searching for qualified candidates for this potential opening. We do not have assurance at this time that the position will be opened and when. This position is contingent upon contract award. Jacobs Technology is looking for a candidate for an Analyst position in the San Diego, California area.The candidate for the Analyst Position should have experience operating computer based systems, preparing computer generated and/or written reports, and making presentations which analyze training or operational data for Navy fleet operating personnel, including large groups (10-30) of personnel consisting of flight crews, ship and submarine commanding officers, and operations personnel. One of the following three: 1) Significant recent experience in analysis of AMW, USW, MIW, STW, SUW, AW, NSW, and/or EW exercise operations, sensors, tactics, and weapons;  2) Significant recent experience generating computer based training materials for Navy operational units or systems;  3) Significant recent experience managing tactical networks.  Experience operating computer based systems, preparing computer generated and/or written reports and making presentations which analyze training and operational data for Navy fleet operating personnel, including large groups (10-30) of personnel consisting of flight crews, ship and submarine commanding officers and operations personnel. Knowledge of Navy operational and administrative procedures and directives.One of the following four: 1) Bachelor of Science/Bachelor of Arts in Engineering or Management;  2) Proven Military Officer Sub-Specialist designation in AMW, USW, MIW, STW, SUW, AW, NSW, or EW;  3) Proven Navy Enlisted Classification in AMW, USW, MIW, STW, SUW, AW, NSW, or EW;  4) Proven Military EW/ELINT operational experience.AND Experience in analysis of AMW, USW, MIW, STW, SUW, AW, and/or EW/CRY exercise operations, sensors, tactics and weapons.  Experience in Navy EW/CRY, AMW, USW, MIW, STW, SUW, and/or AW operations, including exercise scheduling, requirements and resource analysis, planning, execution, data acquisition and support documentation.Must be able to acquire and hold a Secret Security Clearance QualificationPhysical RequirementsMust be able to work at a computer, desk for extended periods. Must be able to interact effectively with all levels of employees and customers.AttendanceWith the exception of approved leave and holidays, attendance is mandatory. This position is expected to be on-site during all regular business hours.Other Essential FunctionsMust take and pass a drug test and background check. Must have/maintain appropriate security clearance as may be required. Must put forward a professional behavior that enhances productivity and promotes teamwork and cooperation. Grooming and dress must be appropriate for the position and must not impose a safety risk/hazard to the employee or others. Must be well-organized with the ability to coordinate and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously. Must be able to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing. Must be able to interface effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization. Must be willing to travel as-needed.

Name: BUSINESS
Description: Change Lives Starting With YoursAt Scripps Health, you will experience the pride, support, and respect that has been repeatedly recognized as one of the nation’s Top 100 Places to work. You’ll be surrounded by people committed to making a difference in the lives of their patients and their teammates. So if you’re open to change, go ahead and unlock your potential.As Compensation Analyst, you will play an integral role in assisting in the development, implementation and administration of compensation programs. You'll accomplish this by participating in compensation surveys, maintaining job structures and documentation, evaluating jobs for market competitiveness, and reviewing base wages and total compensation for conformance to policy. Ensures adherence to FLSA, CA Fair Pay Act, special pay practices and all other pay regulations. You will also implement pay increases and administer incentive plans, maintain the integrity of the human resources information system, and alternate work schedule (AWS) programs and associated files.This is a full time, 8 hour Monday - Friday position. Required Education/Experience/Specialized Skills:Three years of experience in Human Resources or appropriate combination of education and experience.Strong interpersonal skills and ability to form effective, collaborative partnerships.Excellent communication, presentation and coaching skills.Highly organized and detail oriented with the ability to quickly and effectively handle multiple priorities and assignments to meet deadlines while maintaining professional composure.Effective listener, with the ability to identify problems and creatively apply solutions.Preferred Education/Experience/Specialized Skills/Certification:Certified Compensation Professional (CCP) certification.Bachelor's degree.Health care experienceScripps Health is repeatedly named on the Fortune Magazine’s 100 Best Companies to work for, only San Diego-based Company and Becker’s Healthcare Top Hospitals. Scripps Health offers a robust Total Rewards Program designed to compensate and motivate you throughout your career. Scripps Health Total Rewards Program includes a broad range of plans and programs including market competitive pay and performance incentives, health and wellness benefits, financial wellness benefits, work-life resources, learning and development opportunities, and rewards and recognition. Unlock your potential with Scripps Health today.Scripps Health is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity/expression), age, marital status, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Name: Analyst
Description: OverviewT-Solutions is the company people want to work for and work with when seeking global services and innovative solutions. We employ highly qualified and uniquely skilled professionals who are committed to providing services with integrity. We are the preferred partner to deliver excellence and to enrich our clients, employees and communities. Who We Are T-Solutions is a woman owned, veteran owned small business headquartered in Chesapeake, Virginia that creates exceptional, responsive solutions to complex challenges for our global clients in the field of government contracting. We are an innovative, agile provider of specialized, technical solutions and an exceptional cache of capabilities that enable mission-critical operations and decision making. We provide the expertise and guidance needed to help customers succeed in today’s era of defense, security, maintenance engineering, logistics, and business transformation. Our core competencies are aligned with the current needs of our customers; and those competencies anticipate and facilitate work with our customer to address their future needs. We are continually striving to adapt emerging and proven technologies to further enhance the abilities of our customers and partners. Career Opportunity We are currently seeking candidates for an Administrative Assistant position, located in San Diego, CA. The Port Engineer Support Services contract provides support to the U.S. Navy Surface fleet by achieving material readiness within constrained funding levels. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Validate and submit security clearance forms to Security Managers for completion.Educate and support employees with the tools to complete expense reports with accuracy and thoroughness.Create a variety of documents including but not inclusive naval correspondence, directives, status reports, trip reports, meeting minutes, briefing slides, and file setup and maintenance.Enter the Availability Start and End date in VSB with coordination from the Port Engineer.Provide assistance to the Port Engineer’s on closing old availabilities in VSB.Generate and provide the Port Engineers with their CSMP reports.Coordinate and schedule the employee’s participation via the Port Engineer Evolutions Opportunity Calendar.Generate and retrieve metrics data using various software programs. Provide metrics to the proper gov’t and/or Port Engineer authorities.Maintain, review and provide weekly CASREP listing received from MIDPAC, PACNW and SURFPAC and update VSB.Generate and analyze various reports to support Port Engineers and their respective ship assignments.Demonstrate the ability to work independently and be able to communicate effectively both orally and through formal reports.Demonstrate experience in management and coordination with Port Engineer’s and Government officials.Attend and coordinate scheduling calendars with the Port Engineer’s.Required QualificationsPrior Navy 3MC experience preferredKnowledge of U.S. Navy 3M System and ability to run reports and calculate standard system reliability metrics.Proficient in Microsoft Office to include: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access, Project, Visio, and Adobe Software.Three (3) years of experience in developing and maintaining documentation and data management systems involving DoD programs.A high school diploma or GED equivalent is mandatory.Associates Degree or Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university is preferred.Secret Security Clearance Travel required for this position will be ~ 5%. Security RequirementsApplicant will be subject to a security investigation and must meet the eligibility requirements to obtain and maintain a security clearance issued by the US Government. In addition to the security clearance, this position may require an additional background screening for base access. To see if you meet requirements to obtain a Security Clearance click HERE T-Solutions is a rapidly growing, family owned company with a comprehensive employment benefits package, including Medical, Dental, 401k, Life, Disability, AD&D, Paid Vacation, Tuition Reimbursement, and more. Apply to join our family of professionals today! EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER - FEMALES - MINORITIES - VETERANS - DISABLED

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst I
Description: Business Intelligence Analyst I If you're interested in a career within a customer-focused, team-oriented environment that rewards innovation, quality, integrity and collaboration, MedImpact Healthcare Systems, Inc. welcomes your application. MedImpact, is a privately-held pharmacy benefit manager (PBM) headquartered in San Diego, California. Our solutions and services positively influence healthcare outcomes and expenditures, improving the position of our clients in the market. MedImpact offers high-value solutions to payers, providers and consumers of healthcare in the U.S. and foreign markets. Position Summary The Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst I is responsible for developing an in-depth understanding of the underlying data and proper business uses to translate data and information into a format that aids the Configuration Services team in drawing insight from that data. This role will be responsible for the gathering and analysis of key business performance metrics on behalf of Configuration Services and leading the efforts to mine actionable and relevant data to further enhance the department's ability to accurately configure and manage projects and tasks. This role will also collaborate with the teams that deliver the configuration, testing, validation, quality assurance, business analytics, reporting and audit and performance guarantees. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. * Writes complex, highly-optimized queries. visualizations, algorithms, and reports across large volumes of data to create detailed and accurate outputs with understanding of statistics * Identifies analyzes and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets * Performs ad hoc analysis as requested by business owners, or in support of identified business objectives, with special focus on ensuring the highest levels of service, quality and operational efficiencies are achieved * Defines methodology and analytic approach as required for each specific request * Acquires data from primary or secondary data sources and maintains databases and data systems * Reports and measures all departmental KPI's in order to report operational productivity and determine staffing requirements, reduce rework, and prevent performance guarantee payouts * Establishes relational database models and schema, and automates reporting * Modifies, maintains, publishes, enhances, and supports custom reports (MS SQL, Excel, Access, etc.) for both ad-hoc and ongoing needs * Ability to interpret data and analyze results. Understands data standards and identifies data abnormalities. Instills data quality in all outputs that are delivered * Develops and implements data collection systems and other strategies that optimize efficiency and data quality * Creates and maintains technical documentation for various systems, services and business processes including databases and reporting procedures * Writes and maintains detailed documentation of including specifications, expected outcomes, validation methodology/processes, test results, recommendations, version control, and configuration design * Assists with the review, consolidation and reduction of data discrepancies * Works closely with management to prioritize business and information needs * Locates and defines new process improvement opportunities * Trains users in the operations and scheduling of reports Education and/or Experience For consideration, candidates will need a Bachelor's degree (B.S.) from a four-year college or university in IT, economics, math, statistics, science or other related fields in quantitative or analytical discipline and one (1) to three (3) years job related experience and/or training; or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Direct experience should include technical experience in the support and maintenance regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques. Experience with pharmacy claims data, insurance data, managed health care industry or PBM operations is preferred. Computer Skills * Working knowledge of standard business applications, Microsoft Office Suite (MS Access, MS Visio, MS Project, MS Word, and MS PowerPoint), Golden 32 or TOAD and Salesforce * Advanced proficiency with Excel (Pivot tables, pivot charts, conditional formatting, VLOOKUP, nested formulas); VBA macro experience a plus * Strong knowledge of PL/SQL (complex joins, nested subqueries, aggregation, partitions, functions, pivots and unions) * Solid understanding of databases, their architectures and database constraints Certificates, Licenses, Registrations * MYSQL Certification or demonstrated knowledge * Oracle Certified Professional is a plus * SAS Certified Base Programmer a plus Other Skills and Abilities Thorough knowledge of statistical modeling, techniques and practices Expert level ability to analyze data for trends and support findings through thorough documentation Executes and delivers within the confines and timeframes provided by regulatory agencies Ability to prioritize urgent issues effectively Well-developed facilitation and collaboration skills Experience and understanding of how to accomplish deliverables in a matrixed environment Travel This position may require domestic travel up to 15%; attendance may be required at various local conferences and meetings. This position is eligible for Employee Referral Bonus at Level I EOE, M/F/D/V OSHA/ADA: To perform this job successfully, the successful candidate must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.SDL2017

Name: Business Process Analyst - Project Management
Description: Business Process Analyst II  15-Oct-2018 Company General Atomics Aeronautical Systems Job Summary General Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc. (GA-ASI), an affiliate of General Atomics, is a world leader in proven, reliable remotely piloted aircraft and tactical reconnaissance radars, as well as advanced high-resolution surveillance systems.  We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.  We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Business Process Analyst to work within our Aeronautical Systems Material Finance group in Poway, CA. This position, under limited direction is responsible for analyzing business and technical processes to formulate, recommend, and/or develop new/modified business processes. A successful team member will prepare and deliver internal/external presentations as well as knowledge transfer documentation while being highly adaptive/agile in project management style/techniques. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Responds to inquiries, identifies issues, and guides the development on innovative solutions to complex and diverse challenges concerning a variety of business processes, data, and problems which requires tact and discretion in handling.Analyzes, validates and develops business and technical process requirements; develops systems requirements, techniques and controls; and leads implementation efforts of requirements.Provides leadership in determining business and user requirement specifications; leads analysis and verification to ensure consistency, traceability, feasibility and completeness; recommends and implements process improvement.Provides leadership and guidance for knowledge transfer activities and contributes deliverables as required to achieve success in project/solution delivery.Represent the organization as a primary participant and/or lead cross-functional projects that drive value to the business unit or enterprise.Acts as a liaison between business users and information technology staff.Develops and delivers knowledge transfer content for multiple process areas to drive efficiencies in recurring activities.Prepares business process flows and make recommendations/propose solutions.Ensures issues are identified, tracked, reported and driven to solution in a timely manner.Prioritizes and performs work on multiple cross-functional projects simultaneously.Serves as liaison between business process owners and functional groups within the business units.Maintains the confidentiality of staff, management, and sensitive information.Performs other duties as assigned or required.Job ID#21091BRJob Category Engineering, Finance/Accounting, Manufacturing, Product Support, Program/Project Management, Strategic Development Travel Percentage Required0% - 25%Full-Time/Part-Time Full-Time Salary State California City San Diego Clearance Required? No Title Business Process Analyst - Project Management Job QualificationsTypically requires a Bachelor’s degree in a related field and three or more years of experience as a business process analyst working with computerized management systems to include, but not limited to, product life cycle systems. May substitute equivalent experience in lieu of education.Experience with project Management is required and a PMP certification is highly desirable.Proficiency using Microsoft Project & Visio is required.Must understand business process/life cycle management principles, theories and concepts as well as industry practices, techniques, and standards.Ability to develop &/or recommend solutions to a variety of problems of diverse scope and complexity.Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills.Ability to communicate effectively (both verbally and written) with both technical and non-technical resources.Presentations skills to accurately document scope, status, value-proposition, etc. to a variety of audiences.Strong interpersonal skills and ability to interact professionally with all levels of staff, leadership, and other external parties.Ability to operate as a business partner to functional/process areas and team well with others.Ability to work independently or lead in a team environment is essential along with extended hours when required.Ability to travel as required but expected to be infrequent.

Name: SaaS Implementation Business Analyst (San Diego)
Description: Are you experienced in working closely with external customers throughout a software implementation and enjoy traveling? Does working for an award-winning organization sound enticing to you? If you are looking for a career move that will give you all of these things, then look no further as we have a fantastic opportunity to join e-Builder as a Business Analyst. About e-Builder: Founded in 1995 and based in Plantation, Florida, e-Builder, a Trimble Company, is the pioneer of a fully integrated, cloud-based construction management software. Our client list reads as the "who's, who" in all our vertical markets: Facebook, CalTech, INOVA Healthcare, and Chicago Transit Authority to name just a few - . As one of the fastest growing companies in South Florida, we are proud to be named a 'Florida Company to Watch,' to be nominated as one of South Florida's best places to work and have our CEO named South Florida Business Journal's Ultimate CEO. We're excited to find innovative ways to combine technology with construction with a fun work environment. To learn more about our award-winning organization and corporate culture visit www.e-builder.net  In this role you will be responsible for implementing e-Builder and guaranteeing product adoption for our clients by working closely with them throughout the entire implementation lifecycle. This includes but is not limited to: Analyze client business process/requirements and develop corresponding process and data flowsPerform gap analysis activities to identify and document any possible requirement gaps as well as provide creative solutions to ambiguous business problemsDevelop materials and deliver training required for each client assigned implementationConfigure based on requirements and business rules for new/existing implementationsAssist with UAT strategies, conditions and evaluation of expected resultsCreate and distribute meeting minutes, status reports, and required documentationAttributes/Skills Required:SaaS Software implementation experienceAbility to effectively present and communication information to customers, strategic business partners, and company managementPrior experience with writing and analyzing business and system requirement documents that convey complex business analysis and technology solutionsExperience with SaaS software testing strategies, conditions and evaluation of expected resultsHistory of recommending and implementing process improvementsGeneral understanding of financial reporting (Cash flows, G.L. Accounts, etc.)Proficient experience with MS Office Suite, Visio and web technologiesCollege degree preferred If you have the ability to travel around the country up to 75% of the time and can accomplish the above then you will make you an excellent match for this position and will have what it takes to be a successful Business Analyst here at e-Builder! We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free Workplacewww.e-builder.net

Name: Sr Business Process Analyst
Description: Position Summary:This role functions as a key member of the Global Supply Planning team and is responsible for collecting, analyzing and reporting data to help improve supply chain operations and decision making. Requires collaboration with marketing, sales, customer service, manufacturing, quality, finance, warehousing & logistics functions. Responsibilities:Generate reports and monitor results, identify and facilitate actions to drive improvements to ensure improved customer experience and more efficient operations. Demand patterns, costs, productivity, constraint utilization and fulfillment metrics are a few examples for reporting and analysis.Perform detailed scenario analysis based on business needs. Solve problems by collecting and analyzing data, offering and implementing solutions, to achieve the desired resultsReview and clean source data to ensure accuracy and integrity; create a sustainable approach to data managementPropose visualization ideas, develop dashboards and KPIs and provide assistance with creation of Ad hoc reportsUnderstands business and functional requirements and works with users to develop such documentation for assigned projectsWork with management team to develop supply chain disciplines and best practices including processes and procedures. Maintain departmental files, documents and databases and generate reports for management and others, as neededAssist in developing and implementing and achieving departmental goals and objectives Perform other related tasks as required and complete special projects as assigned Requirements:Knowledge of Supply Chain or OperationsKnowledge of ERP/MRP systems (SAP IBP ideal) and other enterprise software applications, word processing, spreadsheets, functional databases and project managementDemonstrated critical thinking, problem solving abilities and flexibility to adapt to new tools & systemsStrong data analysis skills including data standardization, data clean up, data consolidation and data presentationEffective verbal and written communication with the ability to prepare and deliver effective presentationsExcellent math skills, strong organizational and time management skills and attention to detailUnderstanding of change management and life cycle processes, familiarity with GMP and ISO requirements is preferredAPICS CPIM or CPM certification desirableExcellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work with all levels of management and to interface well with cross-functional teammatesEducation:Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Operations, Business Administration, Life Sciences or related field with 5 years materials planning and inventory control experience including at least 2 years working with multiple product lines. Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description Summary Job Description Summary  The Business Systems Analyst I is responsible for assisting in process definition and development of documentation related to the quality and accuracy of data entered into the LSRR operational systems. Executes transactions in these operational systems for product lifecycle data as defined through documented processes. Coordinates and completes required data entry for material introduction, change and discontinuation through the defined processes. Participates in the analysis of master data and communicates to the business data findings based on this analysis. Works in systems within an ISO compliant environment, creating and maintaining required system documentation for the business. Provides business support for Functional Excellence improvements to the Global Product Development System (GDPS) and other Continuous Improvement projects. Coordinates and collaborates cross-functionally with all areas of the business relating to product lifecycle data management. Typically requires detailed instructions on most work assignments.  Duties and Responsibilities  Business Systems Development Assists in identifying and evaluating system solutions and procedures which meet user requirements.Participates in analysis of business requirements, cross-functional information dependencies and systems impacts.Documents business and system processes.Maintains close working relationship with appropriate business partners to insure system functionality accurately represents data.Explores enhancements and other functionalities of the business system to maximize the efficiency of LSRR business systems. Information Integration & Documentation Partners with applicable departments/units to ensure cross-functional integration of information and processes.Reviews functional specifications to ensure that business requirements are met.Communicates data standards, assisting with data integrity maintenance during database conversions. Subject Matter Expertise Develops and builds knowledge of LSRR business processesKeeps abreast of the basic requirements for compliance in own area of work and complies with those requirementsParticipates in activities that review processes to recommend changes and process improvements where justifiable. Policies and Procedures Follows all Environmental, Health and Safety (EH&S) policies and procedures. Participates in EH&S programs.Takes responsibility for safety in immediate work area. Notifies supervisor of all observed hazardous conditions or unsafe work practices. May provide recommendations on maintaining the safety of the work environment.Participates as required in training on regulatory issues affecting own area of work. Brings regulatory compliance questions/issues to the attention of management.Performs other related duties and assignments as required.QualificationsTypically requires a Bachelors Degree in a scientific, technical, or business discipline with a minimum of 1 year experience working in computer databases, integrating and translating business processes into operational systems. High School GED/Diploma required, candidates with experience equivalent to a Bachelor's Degree will be consideredDemonstrated knowledge of MS Office and proficient with MS Excel and/or other similar databasesBasic understanding of SAP functionality.Experience within a medical, pharmaceutical or biotechnology environment, or equivalent combination of related education and experience is preferred.Knowledgeable of structured documentation and change control systems, tools for process improvement, Quality System Regulation, ISO 9000 and, where applicable, GMP guidelines preferredFamiliar with structured phase-gate product development and portfolio management processes preferredEffective written and oral communication skillsAbility to follow established policies and proceduresStrong interpersonal skillsDemonstrated results oriented capabilitiesGood analytical and problem-solving skillsTHE ABOVE STATEMENTS ARE INTENDED TO DESCRIBE THE GENERAL NATURE AND LEVEL OF WORK BEING PERFORMED BY PEOPLE ASSIGNED TO THIS JOB. Name: Business Systems Analyst - Finance
Description: Business Systems Analyst II  07-Nov-2018 Company General Atomics Aeronautical Systems Job Summary General Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc. (GA-ASI), an affiliate of General Atomics, is a world leader in proven, reliable remotely piloted aircraft and tactical reconnaissance radars, as well as advanced high-resolution surveillance systems.  We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.  We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Business Systems Analyst to work within our Aeronautical Systems Material Finance group in Poway, CA. The person selected for this role will be responsible for reporting on material cost movements involving government contracts and internal company projects. They will assist the business by tracking material allocations to ensure integrity in programmatic costs. This includes, but is not limited to, developing unique data analytics and tracking methodologies to be used for reporting on material cost values and their movements within the system. Additionally, they will assist programs in developing sound ETCs based on signals from the SAP MRP system. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Plans, tracks, analyzes, and reports material cost allocation status for projects of varying contract type, size, and complexity.Works in a team environment with financial and management staff to track and control project material cost activity.Interacts with management to analyze the performance for manufacturing projects on a recurring basis, and works with the MRP systems to generate accurate Estimates to Completion (ETCs).Develops and implements reporting procedures to review material actual cost status and valuation of manufacturing work to be completed.Performs monitoring, analysis, and reporting on assigned projects regarding the status of procurements for the purposes of material cost reporting.Provides management with clear, timely, and accurate information recommendations with which to make decisions.Identifies, defines, and communicates process &/or training improvement opportunities to leadership.Manages ambiguity effectively and is comfortable with agile unstructured tasksResponsible for converting data into information that can be prepared and presented in a consumable formatPerforms other duties as assigned or required.Job ID#21452BRJob Category Finance/Accounting, Information Technology, Material and Production Control, Program/Project Management, Strategic Development Travel Percentage Required0% - 25%Full-Time/Part-Time Full-Time Salary State California City San Diego Clearance Required? No Title Business Systems Analyst - Finance Job QualificationsTypically requires educational training equivalent to a Bachelor’s Degree in a related field and three or more years of experience as an analyst tracking and reporting costs on manufacturing programs of varying size and complexity. May substitute equivalent experience in lieu of education.Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills.Must possess strong verbal and written communication skills to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical resources.Strong presentations skills needed to accurately train and report findings to a variety of audiences.Proficient with various software suites including but not limited to: MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Project, MS Visio, MS Access and SQL.Ability to work independently or as part of a team is essential.Must be able to work extended hours and travel as required.Preferred Qualifications:Basic understanding of earned value.Self-starter who takes initiative on independent and team tasks.Experience with SAP and GPD is highly desirable.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Join the Cognetic team as a Senior Business Analyst in a strategic new role! The person in this position will join a team responsible for implementing a new county property tax application. Participates as a member of a Validation Team; may lead small teams. Utilizing the testing methodology, applies specialization to develop a Test Plan for a test level to be executed for a project, as specified in the Testing Strategy for the project. Coordinates and collaborates with others in analyzing collected requirements to ensure the testing solutions meet customer needs and expectations. Assists in the preparation of estimates for the performance of the various activities defined in the Test Plan. Designs complex testing scenarios and test cases that will demonstrate conformance to all functional and non-functional requirements, relative to the test level, as defined in business or technical specifications. Reviews and analyzes test results to confirm, establish, and communicate the cause of the discrepancy. Identifies inadequacies and improvement opportunities in the methods/standards and recommends changes. Stays current on established tools, techniques, and technologies. Supports/leads knowledge management and collaboration through participation in testing discussions, communities and improving testing collateral through lessons learned. Requirements:Typically a technical Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field and a minimum of 6 years related experience or a Master’s degree and a minimum of 4 years of experience. Experience working for a Consulting Services organization. Experience working with State or Local government a plus. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work effectively in a time critical environment. Must excel in an agile / iterative development environment.

Name: Senior Analyst Sales and Business Operations
Description: Position Summary:The Senior Analyst Sales and Business Operations role is responsible for forecasting and demand analytics activities associated with both internal and external customers, and products globally. This person creates and manages demand planning databases, metrics reporting and dashboards, and all consensus meeting inputs and reporting. In managing these inputs, the Senior Analyst Sales and Business Operations role is also accountable for overall statistical forecast quality, forecast exception reporting, and managing customer forecasting and regional splits. They will additionally serve as the analytics integration point for demand planning, sales and supply chain organizationsThe Senior Analyst Sales and Operations role may additionally manage forecasting and demand planning for selected product groups. This requires development of demand forecasts utilizing statistics, stakeholder inputs, and marketing intelligence. In this role they will facilitate stakeholder meetings; directing participants towards collaboration and consensus in finalizing the demand forecast as well as identifying supporting demand drivers and assumptions. The Senior Analyst Sales and Business Operations role also participates in the supply chain demand/supply gap reviews and helps support the overall S&OP process.All About YouResponsibilities:Serve as analytics lead for the demand planning team; including S&OP reporting, analytical Excel-based tools, SQL, Tableau report writing, and other data management tools.Manage Sub-Region and Customer forecasts; working to improve modeling techniques and disaggregation quality, along with exception reporting and root cause analysis.Develop and maintain complex forecasting models using excel and/or a demand management toolCreate, manage and report statistical demand exceptions, prepare forecast data, and evaluate forecast results using root cause analysis and correctionCollaborate with sales, marketing, and customer finance to understand customer-based forecast driversUtilize a collaborative and consensus approach by working with Sales, Marketing and Finance to obtain and ensure that current and accurate information is used for demand forecastsAssist with implementation of demand planning tools.Work closely with Demand Planning Managers in preparing consensus meeting materials including graphs, charts and metrics reportingAssume responsibility for creating and maintaining team metrics reporting including forecast accuracy and biasWork closely with the commercial Sales team; both in supplying product consensus forecasts and gleaning customer insights and other key demand driversClosely coordinate and communicate customer action plans with supply planningWork cross-functionally with Supply Chain, Sales and Finance to provide and integrate databases, dashboards and other reporting and data requirementsRequirements:3-5 years of demand analytics experience, preferably with SAP/APO or Kinaxis/Rapid ResponseDirect experience in working with a demand management implementation preferredBasic understanding of statistical analysisKnowledge of ERP/MRP, BI Tools, CRM systems. Experience with SAP a plusExpert proficiency in Excel, Tableau and PowerPointStrong analytical skills and detail orientationExcellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong presentation skillsExperience in leading and facilitating demand consensus-related meetingsDemonstrated initiative, solid judgment and creativity in overcoming obstaclesAbility to work in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environmentAbility to interface well at all levels of the organizationDemonstrated experience in collaboration with cross-functional teammatesDemonstrated project management skillsAbility to analyze and resolve planning problems independently and collaboratively with co-workersEducation:BA/BS in Marketing, Analytics, CS, Data Analysis, Economics, or Business. MBA preferred.Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information. Name: Senior Business Analyst, Services Operations
Description: Senior Business Analyst / Services Operations  Location: Santa Clara, CA or San Diego, CA This position reports to: Senior Director, Global Services Operations  ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.  With a combination of exceptional analytical skills, an insatiable curiosity, and an entrepreneurial “get stuff done” mindset, you’ll help us fundamentally improve how Services run our business.  What You Get To Do In This Role Be the liaison for Services Finance and Services Operations organizations and partner with IT Business Intelligence to build core operating dashboards to help teams drive operational rigor and manage performanceSuccessfully lead projects from vision through executionUnderstand, define and document business requirementsEffectively and efficiently communicate issues and problem solve with IT Tableau developersDrive PSA OpenAir Reporting implementation.Plan, coordinate and lead UAT functionsPrepare quarterly KPI reporting by roleDrive automation of weekly and monthly business review analytical pushesBecome an expert at creating and editing PSA OpenAir cross functional reportingProactively investigate potential problems or technical issues, recommend thoughtful solutionsBe an integral part of building and planning 2019 roadmap to improve Services analytical capabilities and then execute to plan In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:  Minimum 7 years combined experience in either business operations or financial analytics Minimum of at least 3 years as a financial analyst Minimum Intermediate Tableau experience ServiceNow platform experience is a plus OpenAir PSA tool a plus Expert Excel skills Ability to effectively communicate within a team environment and across organizational levels to include co-workers, managers, and internal customers Ability to influence business and drive a project to on-time completion Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal, and very strong interpersonal skills Ability to solve and present complex problems in an understandable way to stakeholders and business leaders Strong leadership skills Attention to detail and ability to communicate effectively to different audiences Ability to work independently or work with a team, and multi-task in a fast-paced environment Self-starter with strong analysis skills. We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business

Name: Business Systems Analyst Intern
Description: Requisition Number:202963Position Title: Intern-MIS (I) External Description: Our summer internship program lasts 10-12 weeks beginning in May/June and ending in August/September. Fast-paced, flexible, fun. The Teradata culture isnt just about one kind of person. So many individuals make up who we are, making us that much more unique. Its what sets apart the dynamic, diverse and collaborative environment that is Teradata.Our TeamThe Information Services Department at Teradata is responsible for providing world class IT support and leadership to more than 12,000 Teradata employees and contractors across the business. As Teradata under goes a transformational change to deliver analytics at scale, anywhere, anytime; Teradata ITS is partnering with the different business units to deliver better long-term technology value. With this goal in mind, ITS is looking to hire interns with a science/technology background who can assist us in delivering a pervasive data intelligence landscape. Your OpportunityYou will team with other IT technologists to use your creativity and technical skills to help implement and develop internal business applications and company processes in a fast-paced agile environment. You will learn and work with our IT team to build your skills in many different disciplines such as networking, development, and cloud integration (ServiceNow, SalesForce, Workday). Additionally, you will provide practical IT skills using languages (python, R, .Net, Java), relational databases (SQL), Microsoft SharePoint, and ServiceNow. In this role, you will gain an in-depth understanding of company capabilities and services using the newest versions of reporting and analysis communication tools to assist with the migration of existing corporate data into warehouse views.Qualifications/Requirements CountryEEOText_Description: Teradata is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and commits to hiring returning veterans. City: San Diego State: California Community / Marketing Title: Business Systems Analyst Intern Job Category: College & Interns Company Profile: With all the investments made in analytics, its time to stop buying into partial solutions that overpromise and underdeliver. Its time to invest in answers. Only Teradata leverages all of the data, all of the time, so that customers can analyze anything, deploy anywhere, and deliver analytics that matter most to them. And we do it at scale, on-premises, in the Cloud, or anywhere in between. We call this Pervasive Data Intelligence. Its the answer to the complexity, cost, and inadequacy of todays analytics. And it's the way Teradata transforms how businesses work and people live through the power of data throughout the world. Join us and help create the era of Pervasive Data Intelligence. Name: #96064 ARC Business Systems Analyst
Description: UCSD Layoff from Career Appointment: Apply by 10/10/18 for consideration with preference for rehire. All layoff applicants should contact their Employment Advisor. Special Selection Applicants: Apply by 10/19/18. Eligible Special Selection clients should contact their Disability Counselor for assistance.DESCRIPTIONThe Academic Resource Center (ARC) Infrastructure team is looking for a talented individual who can help deliver impactful change to both new and existing business applications on the ServiceNow platform. This position works directly with the Systems Lead, HS leadership and subject matter experts, (both functional and technical) within the organization to ensure successful development and adoption of new processes and applications. The incumbent will help with the maintenance, support and audit of our Faculty and Academic Information Repositories. Key Responsibilities 1) Partner and work collaboratively with project teams and business stakeholders to gain an understanding of business requirements, translate and document those requirements into solution recommendations, and work with the development team on projects throughout the software development lifecycle.  2) Recommend process improvements through more effective use of the ServiceNow system and other CRMs.  3) Assists with project plan development and end user documentation. Gathers and analyzes data to prepare business process and procedural documentation. Scope projects and clearly identify risks, timeliness, dependencies and resources.  4) Work on knowledge management projects which includes the creation or reformatting of existing documents into a living and sustainable Knowledge Base.  5) Partner with internal stakeholders to help drive adoption and maximize the value of ServiceNow.  6) Work with management to prioritize business and information needs and determine methods to collect, manage and visualize/report on operational data using ServiceNow.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS A Bachelor's Degree in related area; and/or equivalent experience/training.One to two (1 - 2) years of experience working with the ServiceNow platform, or similar Software as a Service CRM solutions.Two (2) or more years of relevant business systems analyst experience.Demonstrated proficiency with SQL coding.Understanding of the application development lifecycle process, including requirement analysis, quality assurance, design, scheduling, implementation, issue tracking, version control and deployment.Experience with design and development of training programs and materials for business process and specific information systems applications.Ability to coordinate, schedule and deliver training content utilizing different media types. Ability to adapt the training needs of others at various learning levels.Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization.Strong communication skills for group activities including expressing ideas effectively, seeking and respecting the opinion of others, active listening, and willingness to share ideas.Demonstrated ability to improve processes by assessing procedures, seeking information and opinions, developing and implementing changes as appropriate.Solid effective communication and interpersonal skills. Skill in listening, anticipating, and responding to the needs and training of users.Provide exceptional customer service skills measured by outcome rather than activities, including tact, diplomacy, and effective verbal, written, and electronic communication skills that facilitate professional, effective, and courteous interaction with diverse population.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSKnowledge of and experience with Active Directory; Single Sign-on using: Digested Token, SAML 2.0. and Web Services integrations.LEAN Six Sigma Green or Black Belt Certified.SPECIAL CONDITIONSEmployment is subject to a criminal background check.Employee must be available to work evenings and weekends.Employee must be available to travel as required.

Name: Technical Business Analyst, Integrations
Description: Position Overview: ClosingCorp, a leading provider of residential real estate closing cost data and technologies, is looking for an individual to join our team as a Technical BusinessAnalyst for Integrations. This role will lead integration projects and ensure partner solutions are clearly understood and desired outcomes achieved. Working with internal stakeholders and external clients to clarify and document requirements, changes to specifications and workflow solutions, a successful candidate will facilitate collaborative and accountable partnerships and outcomes that meet all party's business needs related to connectivity and integrations.  The selected candidate will need to quickly acquire a deep knowledge of ClosingCorp's products, services, and a clear understanding of our business model. They will work on multiple projects from across several of the ClosingCorp product lines and will need to be comfortable discussing various technical implementation options.  The Integration Analyst will work with ClosingCorp's Sales, Client Services, Product, Data Management, Onboarding, Client Support, and Engineering teams in a collaborative effort to deliver the defined solution. General Duties and Responsibilities:Acts as an integrations subject matter expert to assist Client Services and Support teamsWorks individually or within a team on integration projects to meet specific client requirements.Maintains client specific documentation such as updating the client workflow, creating and maintaining the client solutions documentAssists in maintaining internal documentation including sequence diagrams, workflows, data dictionary, iGuides, and SchemasAssists in maintaining external documentation on the Self-Serve Document PortalExpertly researches and documents client needs, technology or regulations related to system designAnalyzes system impacts to other internal and external systems or processes and proceduresShares new client requests with Client Services for possible submission to intake committeeWorks with Client Services to develop agenda items for Monthly Base Integration Relationship calls and to fulfill related action itemsWrites test plans and conducts a variety of test cases to confirm the outcomes of the requirement changes meet the expectations of the business partners and clientsWrites test plans and test cases to ensure enhancements made to applications meet client needs and that application integrity is maintained.Assists in testing integrations prior to ClosingCorp monthly releases and/or the client's releaseWorks with the Product team to help define client requested product features, the strategic value, and high level system requirementsPerforms other related duties as requiredRequired Experience and Skills:Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present technical and non-technical information to any audienceAbility to provide excellent customer service to business partners and clients to ensure project success and client satisfactionExcellent analytical, decision-making, problem-solving, interpersonal, team, conflict management and time management skillsKnowledge of systems development life cycles such as Agile, Waterfall, Prototyping, etc.Ability to implement solutions and technical requirements by leveraging the appropriate tools and techniquesAbility to research ideas and present outcomes in a clear and concise mannerProficiency in business modeling and requirements definition disciplines through Unified Modeling Language (UML), use cases, etc.Proficiency in quality management methods, tools and technologiesFamiliarity with reading and testing XML and/or JSONPreferred Education and Industry Knowledge:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experienceKnowledge of financial services industry, including Point of Sale and Loan Origination SystemsFamiliarity with general industry regulations including TRID and RESPAFamiliarity with MISMO standards and documentation

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Mitchell International, Inc. is a leading provider of information and workflow solutions to the Property & Casualty Claims Industry and their supply chain partners. We solve interesting and complex problems that directly affect the customers our clients serve. We are constantly adapting to stay on the forefront of emerging technologies and we work diligently to maintain our position as a thought leader within our industry.  We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Technical Business System Analyst (Software Development) who has passion for delivering high quality world class software products through SAFe Agile methodology (Alignment, Transparency, Execution and Built-In Quality BDD/ATDD). that are cost effective and meet user requirements.Configures system settings and options; plans and executes unit, integration and acceptance testing; and creates specifications for systems to meet business requirements.Designs details of automated systems.Pprovides consultation to users in the area of automated systems and lead cross-functional linked teams to address business or systems issues.Perform impact analysis on platform & project-specific technical topicsLead design discussions within the team and with other technology partners and project managersWork with product, business and application teams to write technical user stories for a SOA/services/messaging development teamResearch code to determine current system functionalityExecute testing of REST and SOAP web services using tools like Soap UI/ Ready API to verify that the services meet the acceptance criteria defined in the user storiesCheck application and operational logs to investigate any requirements or issues team’s referenceDevelop / document end to end customer workflow.Document user requirements using use cases.Bachelor’s Degree Computer Science, Computer Information Systems or Software Engineering degree preferred5+ years of hands-on experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Technical Analyst or in a related discipline with an emphasis on delivering cutting-edge technology within Cloud Based Software Develoment & Service industry.Ability to read Java code and service definitions in order to understand existing system behaviorExperience working with Spring, SOAP, REST, Micro services, XML and JSON message formats in a shared services/enterprise level organizationStrong understanding of BDD/TDD and handson expert level experience in writing technical user stories in TFS/JIRA using industry standard notations like GherkinsWell versed with common Agile terms and methodology and using tools like TFS/JIRA and Confluence.Understanding of SQL, stored procedure and database scriptingUnderstanding of software development processes and proceduresExperience using the IDEs such as Eclipse, IDEA IntelliJ, Visual Studio, ReSharperStrong verbal and written communication skillsStrong analytical and problem solving skillsAbility to forge lasting relationships with other scrum team membersFamiliarity with service-oriented environments, and better development practicesStrong knowledge of UML.Good understanding of Agile testing.Familiarity with XML design and mapping tools. ***This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship***  Mitchell International, an equal opportunity employer, values the diversity of our workforce and the knowledge of our people. Mitchell will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, age, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Name: SAP Business Systems Analyst - Finance
Description: CA SAP Functional Bus Analyst III (ca)  30-Jul-2018 Company General Atomics Job Summary General Atomics (GA), and its affiliated companies, is one of the world’s leading resources for high-technology systems development ranging from the nuclear fuel cycle to remotely piloted aircraft, airborne sensors, and advanced electric, electronic, wireless and laser technologies.  We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.  We are currently in need of an SAP Business Systems Analyst to join our Finance & Accounting value stream team here in San Diego, CA.  This team supports the Human Resources, Payroll, and Facilities organizations as well as the labor/timekeeping functions and other GA organizations such as, the Security, Safety, and Publications organizations across all of General Atomics & Affiliates. This team also supports operations as well as strategic projects for these various organizations. Functional and technical scope of work expands beyond SAP and into Oracle Apex applications, Commercial Off-the-Shelf applications, and Cloud systems.  This position is responsible for hands on solution architecture, delivery, and ongoing management of the Finance & Accounting (F&A) functions using SAP application suites – ECC, BPC, Concur and Business Intelligence (BI). DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:As part of GA’s ITS Value Stream team, the individual will participate in supporting the GA&A business in the following value stream tracks: Finance (FI) APARFixed AssetsGLPSControlling (CO)Grouping Pegging and Distribution (GPD)Travel Management (Concur)Support and/or lead meetings and discussions on routine ITS projects under minimal supervision: Perform some Project Management DutiesFacilitate process-oriented meetingsUnderstand and identify areas for process improvement through functional and technical solutionsDistinguish between a reasonable business requirement vs. solution requirementDocument the process flow in a swim lane formatEngage customers for user acceptance testingFollows established change control procedures for migration to QA and Production.Write functional specifications for complex development objects (Forms, Reports, Interfaces, Conversion, Enhancements, and Workflow) Prototype solution options theoretically and in available systems such as a sandboxConfigure SAP system in the responsible modules and manage transports involved in system configuration and development using Solution Manager - CHARMWork closely with the development, security, administration teams, and other functional analysts for cross-functional delivery of solutionsMust make “principled decisions” by maintaining the strict confidentiality of sensitive informationPerform other duties as assigned or requiredJob ID#19910BRJob Category Information Technology Travel Percentage Required None Full-Time/Part-Time Full-Time Salary State California City San Diego Clearance Required? No Title SAP Business Systems Analyst - Finance Job QualificationsTypically requires a bachelor’s degree in information technology or related field along with five or more years of progressive applications.Must demonstrate an understanding of SAP principles, theories, concepts and techniques.SAP functional experience in FICO, PS, GPD, BPC, Concur modules desired.ABAP debugging skills, knowledge of user exits, function modules, and relational database skills are preferredMust possess the ability to follow best practices regarding documentation and unit testing.Must be able to manage several tickets and other deliverables in a fast-paced environment and multi-task without sacrificing quality of work.Must demonstrate a thorough understanding of SAP methodology, principles, theories, concepts and techniquesProject Lead and Project Management execution skills required.Must “Lean Forward” by possessing the ability to contribute to the development of new processes and solutions, as well as effectively identify, analyze and resolve business process and technical issues.Must be a team player with ability to “work as one” with co-workers and demonstrate professional/social interpersonal relationship management skillsMust be able to work extended hours and travel between Company facilities as required.Must possess the ability to understand new concepts quickly and apply them in an evolving environment while contributing to the development of new processes.Must be customer focused and possess: (1) the ability to identify and analyze issues and develop solutions to a variety of complex and diverse problems; (2) excellent analytical, verbal and written communication skills to accurately document, report, and present findings; (3) excellent interpersonal skills to interface with all levels of employees, management and external contacts; (4) the ability to maintain the confidentiality of sensitive information; and (5) excellent computer skills. Ability to work independently or in a team environment is essential, to multi-task in a fast-paced work environment. Experience working in a Government contracting environment.SAP, accounting and finance functional experience in Aerospace and Defense industry is a major plus.Must be a U.S. Person to work in export controlled areas.

Name: Senior Systems Business Analyst
Description: ABOUT US: Established in 1946,  Bergelectric Corp. has made its mark on the construction industry by providing  the highest quality electrical and technology systems. We are one of the  largest, privately held, electrical contractors in the United States. During  the last decade, Engineering News Record (ENR) has consistently ranked us among  the top 20 specialty contractors. We offer competitive salaries and a range of  benefits including, but not limited to; comprehensive medical benefit packages,  401(k), and a pension plan. SUMMARY: Bergelectric Corp.  has a full-time opening available at our Escondido (San Diego) facility  for a Senior Oracle HCM Systems Analyst. See below for description of the  duties and requirements for the position: SYSTEMS ANALYST/LEAD -  ORACLE HCMOverview: Seeking a qualified  systems analyst to support HCM suite of applications – Human Resources,  Payroll, Benefits and Time Entry in an Oracle EBS environment. SYSTEMS ANALYST/LEAD -  ORACLE HCMRequirements:Over 7 years of experience in  implementing/supporting enterprise class systems like Oracle EBSAt least 5 years directly  supporting HR/Payroll modules and usersThorough understanding of all  major functions and processes in HR and PayrollExperience working with Oracle  to resolve issues, bugs and patchesExperience with Payroll taxesExposure to 3rd party  time entry systems such as Kronos, ePay is desirableTechnical skills at a minimum  to include ability to write ad-hoc SQL queries to extract and analyze data  as needed, troubleshoot/write fast formulas.Exposure to EBS version 12.2.4  is a plusPrior experience working in a  Project centric construction organization is a plusBe the single point of contact  from IT for all things HR and Payroll.Work closely with users to  stabilize the new Oracle EBS system. Help troubleshoot issues and bugs  with a focus on ensuring accurate and smooth payroll runs.Look for opportunities for  improvement in both business processes and supporting systems.Document new requirements,  participate in overall design, test and implement new features.KEYWORDS: Oracle eBusiness Suite,  Oracle EBS, R12, 12.13, HR, Human Resources, Payroll, OTL, Benefits, OAB, Fast  formulas, Business Analyst, Sr. Systems Analyst, Senior Systems Analyst,  Systems Specialist, Oracle Analyst, Oracle Specialist, AP, AR, Accounting, GL,  General Ledger, Projects, Project Accounting, Assets, month-end, Ledgers,  Security, ebTax, ebusiness Tax  Bergelectric Corp. is an  equal opportunity employer that sees diversity as a positive force in a  drug-free workplace. We encourage minorities, women, veterans and disabled  individuals to apply. EOE  Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled/VEVRAA Contractor

Name: #96660 Business Tech Support Analyst
Description: UCSD Layoff from Career Appointment: Apply by 11/21/2018 for consideration with preference for rehire. All layoff applicants should contact their Employment Advisor. Special Selection Applicants: Apply by 12/03/2018. Eligible Special Selection clients should contact their Disability Counselor for assistance.This position has recently been accreted by UPTE TX union, and will be a part of that Union moving forward.DESCRIPTIONProvides day-to-day advanced consultation, training, instruction and troubleshooting/problem-solving to technical staff and end users for hardware, software, network and related computer systems, handheld and peripheral devices and ensures their operation for individuals and groups of computer users. Analyzes, recommends, installs, configures and evaluates systems and tools for internal and end user use. Develops and conducts tests of hardware and software and reports on configurations and behavior. Develops and provides technical documentation and training. Assesses needs and recommends hardware and software acquisitions and upgrades.  Professional who applies acquired job skills, policies, and procedures to complete substantive assignments/projects/tasks of moderate scope and complexity; exercises judgment within defined guidelines and practices to determine appropriate action. Applies professional business / technical support concepts to resolve hardware, software and networking issues of moderate scope and complexity for a broad range of applications where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Within defined procedures and practices, determines appropriate action.  Provides escalated, broad technical support. Plans and implements hardware and software upgrades. Troubleshoots, resolves or appropriately triages moderately complex network connectivity issues. May provide server administration support to clients. Consults with users to assess and implement file structure needs and perform data migration. Performs backup server administration. Creates and oversees creation of complex technical documentation.  Develops and/or provides training as needed based on consultation with users and understanding of technology including one-on-one and small group training, FAQs, knowledge-based entries organizational-wide and job aids to assist users electronically.  Provides internal technical support to more junior staff members. Assist junior staff in resolving customer problems. Tests hardware, software and configurations and analyzes/summarizes reports of results, drawing conclusions and making recommendations. Supports enterprise/organizational-wide systems and analyzes system dependencies to resolve computing problems. Provides systems analysis support to clients. Analyzes and determines computing needs and makes recommendations on appropriate tools (hardware, software, peripherals). Tests systems and updates internal documentation. May provide input to system redesign or development efforts based on user needs.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS A Bachelor's Degree in related area; and/or equivalent experience/training.Two (2+) or more years of relevant experience.Professional experience, and proven success, providing information systems support and management in a large scale organization.Experience conducting escalated, broad technical support including hardware and software tests, analyzing test results and producing reports of conclusions and recommendations.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSExperience in a healthcare environment.CompTIA Network+ Certification.Apple Certified Macintosh Technician (ACMT).SPECIAL CONDITIONSMust be able to work various hours and locations based on business needs.Employment is subject to a criminal background check and pre-employment physical.
