Name: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst with GreatCall
Description: The position listed below is not with San Diego Interviews but with GreatCall  San Diego Interviews is a private organization that works in collaboration with government agencies to promote emerging careers. Our goal is to connect you with supportive resources to supplement your skills in order to attain your dream career.  Why You ll Love GreatCall: Our values are to be smart, caring, and collaborative. Our employees love the sit/stand desks, onsite workouts & gym, yoga classes, financial planning courses, emphasis on work/life balance, comprehensive benefits, an extra Meaningful Day off, competitive pay, quarterly company sponsored employee events, 401k matching, free healthy snacks and so much more. But don t take our word for it, check out our Glassdoor, Facebook, Instagram, & LinkedIn and see what our employees have to say. We ve also attached more detailed info on our benefits.ABOUT THE TEAMThe Data Services team mission is to unify data across the enterprise to optimize business decisions made at the strategic, tactical, and operational levels of the organization. We accomplish this by providing an Enterprise Data Warehouse, reporting platform, and business processes that provide quality data, in a timely fashion, from any channel of the company and present them in such a manner as to maximize the value of that data for both internal and external customers.ABOUT THE JOBThe Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for partnering with various lines of business within GreatCall by collecting reporting requirements that will assist in delivering insights and driving key decisions. As the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will develop and document requirements for moderate to complex dashboards and operational reports. As a part of the team you will work closely with report developers and data engineers to produce accurate and timely deliverables through technologies like Tableau and data sources such as SQL Server, Hadoop, MongoDB and others. It will be the Senior Business Intelligence Analysts role to not only confirm the quality of the data, but also the quality of calculations and visual understanding. As a senior on the team you will coach and mentor less seasoned analysts in reporting duties and will provide daily guidance to them. The person in this role must be an analytical and critical thinker that can interpret stakeholder requirements and communicate them effectively. RESPONSIBILITIESGather and validate complex reporting requirements by partnering with a wide-spread of business units to develop well-organized insightful reports, dashboards, and other forms of data visualizations to support strategic business decisions.Collaborate with Data Engineering team members to define the architecture of data sources that will support requirements.Produce and maintain reporting requirements and design documentation to ensure governance, accuracy and transparency to the team and stakeholdersPartner with BI developers to translate requirements into tangible deliverables to provide expected results.Perform peer quality reviews on data governance, calculation accuracy, design, performance and appropriate dataset objects (charts, reports, filters, metrics, etc.).Develop moderate to complex reports and dashboards using tools like Tableau and SQL.Manage and support ad-hoc projects to provide business insights and/or process improvements.Develop a strong understanding of the business and its systems to report on key business requirements.Assist with the data quality process to ensure the integrity of data sources consumed by reporting.Provide training and support to groups of end users via classroom setting on the use of GreatCall s reporting solutions.Mentor and coach Business Intelligence Analysts, Business Intelligence developers and business partners within the organization.Participate in creating and maintaining a company wide data dictionary.Other duties as assigned.QUALIFICATIONSEducation: Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experienceExperience:Minimum 5 years experience with gathering & analyzing user requirements requiredMinimum 5 years experience working in the field of analytics requiredMinimum 3 years of experience creating reports, dashboards, and/or summarizing large amounts of data into actionable intelligence to drive business decisions requiredMinimum 3 years of experience with MS SQL Server, MySql, Oracle or PostgreSQL requiredPrior experience with visual data analysis using tools such as Tableau, QlikView/QlikSense, Microstrategy, or other Business Intelligence platforms required Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and execute tasks across multiple projects with tight deadlines and aggressive goals.Understanding of data warehousing concepts and relational data models.Ability to cultivate and maintain productive working relationships with internal business partners.Ability to create and understand ad-hoc SQL queries to analyze and interpret data.Ability to translate business questions into problems solvable using analytics tools,and converting the results of your analyses into visual stories tailored to the needs of the audience.Strong analytical background with the aptitude to compile data in comprehensive reports, analyze trends and make fact-based recommendations.Able to understand complex issues & can clearly articulate complex ideas.Demonstrated ability to champion change, influence and drive results in a complex organization.Experience leading workshops or training sessions within a user community a plus.Excellent verbal and written communication skills and have experience working on and communicating with fast-paced, dynamic teams.Personal AttributesDetail orientedAnalyticalPassionate about dataQuality drivenPositive, outgoing and creative attitudeCommitted to personal development and professional growth - provided by Dice Business Intelligence Analyst

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Due to our continued expansion, we have an immediate opening for an energetic, conscientious and detail-oriented Financial Analyst who enjoys making a difference, being part of a team, and takes pride in their career. The Financial Analyst is responsible for providing financial and strategic analysis support related to the management of ShopCore Properties portfolio of shopping centers. The Financial Analyst will provide support and analysis to the Asset Management and Finance / Capital Market teams in San Diego and Chicago. Analysis projects may include: financial modeling, financial reporting and monitoring and reporting investment performance, and asset-level financial analysis.As the Financial Analyst, one is held accountable to, however not limited to, the following job functions: Develop and analyze reports that identify key operating metrics (i.e.: occupancy, leasing activity, rent, operating margins, estimates of asset value, etc.)Prepare and manage monthly and quarterly financial, retail and valuation reportsAnalyze operating budgets and capital plans, re-forecasts and cash flow assumptionsConduct various financial analyses on investment opportunities, peer market performance and other ad hoc research as requestedCommunicate with all necessary departments to ensure ShopCore remains in compliance with obligations under joint venture agreements and other related documents including property management and asset management agreementsStay abreast of industry trends, transactional activity and outside research perspectives relative to the real estate marketsPrepare and review financial projections and pricing analysesAssist in the coordination of transaction management and financial due diligence related to loan origination and the disposition of propertiesMaintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications and establishing personal networksREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree (B.A./B.S.) in Business Administration or a related discipline (Accounting, Economics, Finance, Real Estate) from an accredited college, university1-3 years previous relevant experienceExcellent verbal and written communicationSelf-motivated, self-directed and capable of working independentlyProficient in Excel, Word, and PowerpointExperience with ArgusPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Prior real estate experience a plus

Name: Sr. Analyst, Advisor Capital
Description: LPL Financial is seeking a strong applicant to join our team as a member of our Corporate Development department working on our Advisor Capital team. As a Sr. Analyst of Advisor Capital, you will lead deep and thoughtful analysis to help our executive management team make informed decisions as well as drive and maintain efficient day-to-day operations. The ideal candidate for this role has a combination of strong business acumen, technical knowledge to develop and deliver tools enabling informed decision making to drive continuous strategic growth.  The Advisor Capital group plays an instrumental role in the analysis and reporting of LPL’s financial information and collaborating with the company’s business units providing overall financial and capital deployment support. This team is directly involved in strategic and general financial analysis, including, but not limited to, supporting growth initiatives through recruiting and potential M&A transactions as well as providing pricing and capital deployment analysis. This role will have direct exposure to top-level management including C-Level executives. Essential Functions•Working with AVP to develop capital deployment strategy and maintain efficient processes•Leverage technology to automate manual work and simplify processes where feasible to create a highly scalable, flexible, and efficient infrastructure.•Interfacing with business unit counterparts to address specific needs of advisors•Monitoring the team’s timely adherence to service level agreements through dashboards and reports, investigating and addressing instances where commitments are not being met•Producing metrics to illustrate business unit’s accuracy, efficiency, and timeliness•Creating reporting and analysis to drive business decisions on capital deployment opportunities•Handle escalations by both internal business partners and our Advisors•Maintain and enhance internal controls, supporting Internal Audit and Compliance quarterly/annual controls testing•Provide ongoing support, coaching, feedback and developmental opportunities to address staff needs in order to engage them and help them be more effective and successful.•Ad-hoc analysis, financial modeling, and additional responsibilities as requiredKey Qualifications•Effective communication, presentation and writing skills•In depth knowledge of financial reporting processes•MS Excel and PowerPoint expert•Experience with enterprise systems and reporting tools is a plus (OBIEE, OFA, Hyperion or other SaaS reporting tools)•Experience with CRM tools such as Salesforce is a plus•Detail oriented with insight to determine applicability of big picture analysis•Ability to work comfortably with incomplete information and deal with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment•Ability to work within a team, take the initiative and show strong attention to detail is critical•Ability to take initiative and create concise and decision supporting analysis is essential•Proactive problem solver, expected to present problems and recommendations simultaneously•Positive attitude, commitment to excellence and integrity•High level of motivation and initiativeEducation•BA/BS degree in Finance, Business, or Economics (or a related discipline) is required.•3 - 5 years corporate finance, investment banking, or corporate development experience preferredAbout LPL Financial: LPL Financial is a leader in the retail financial advice market and the nation’s largest independent broker/dealer*. We serve independent financial advisors and financial institutions, providing them with the technology, research, clearing and compliance services, and practice management programs they need to create and grow thriving practices. LPL enables them to provide objective guidance to millions of American families seeking wealth management, retirement planning, financial planning and asset management solutions. LPL and its affiliates have more than 3,700 employees with primary offices in Boston, Charlotte, and San Diego. Our Culture: If you join LPL, you will join a culture that believes in delivering a world-class client experience and looks to all employees to contribute to that goal by sharing their creativity, experience, and passion for continuous improvement. As a destination of choice, our top priorities are growth and development, social responsibility, and financial health for our employees.  We offer competitive compensation and industry leading benefits, including a wellness facility with onsite fitness classes, healthy meal choices, and a walk-in clinic. We support employee financial health through a 401k match, ESPP, and employee discounts. Work/life balance is our foundation and is supported through paid holidays, and paid time off (including time to volunteer). We foster a diverse work environment through Employee Resource Groups and diverse strategic partnerships.  Join the LPL team and help us make a difference by turning life’s aspirations into financial realities. Please login or create an account to apply to this position. Principals only. EOE  *As reported by Financial Planning magazine, June 1996-2017, based on total revenue.

Name: #94157 Strategy Analyst
Description: UCSD Layoff from Career Appointment: Apply by 07/11/2018 for consideration with preference for rehire. All layoff applicants should contact their Employment Advisor. Eligible Disability Counseling and Consulting services (DCC) or Special Selection clients should contact their Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor for assistance.DESCRIPTIONThe Analyst position reports to the Director of Strategic Initiatives and Executive Affairs and is responsible for analytic and project management support for the Strategy Office. This role supports the development of a comprehensive healthcare network of owned and affiliated entities, including the UC San Diego Faculty Practice, the UC San Diego Physician Network and the UC San Diego Health Care Network. Name: IT Business Systems Analyst
Company: Sanford Burnham Prebys Medical Discovery Institute
Description: Sanford Burnham Prebys Medical Discovery Institute (SBP) is an independent nonprofit research organization that blends cutting-edge fundamental research with robust drug discovery to address unmet clinical needs in the areas of cancer, neuroscience, immunity, and metabolic disorders. The Institute invests in talent, technology, and partnerships to accelerate the translation of laboratory discoveries that will have the greatest impact on patients. Recognized for its world-class NCI-designated Cancer Center and the Conrad Prebys Center for Chemical Genomics, SBP employs about 1,000 scientists and staff in San Diego (La Jolla), Calif., and Orlando (Lake Nona), Fla. For more information, visit us at SBPdiscovery.org. The Institute can also be found on Facebook at facebook.com/SBPdiscovery and on Twitter @SBPdiscovery.  Summary  The Business Systems Analyst will develop standard reports for applications, serve as the principal owner of the organization's report writing tools, maintain and administer business system security and user accounts for multiple systems, and troubleshoot administrative software applications and third-party products. Under general direction the Business Systems Analyst works with and provides services to many different areas and position levels within the organization, all with varying degrees of need and complexity. The position provides an exciting opportunity to be part of a cutting-edge, thriving scientific research organization and a valuable member of a dynamic and cohesive information technology team. accessCoordinates with Human Resources and Information Technology staff to follow through on all employee status changesTerminates user accounts as authorized and maintains auditable documentation to attainedThree years' experience in report development, with demonstrated strength in supporting business systems preferredExcellent knowledge of SQL/TSQL programming is requiredExperience in writing interfaces and creating reports using SQL/TSQLExperience working with different modules of an ERP system is preferred Other Knowledge, skills, and/or Abilities Combination of financial, analytic and technical systems skills is preferredMust be a "hands on" professional willing to perform required tasks to get the job doneOutstanding customer service demeanor and excellent interpersonal skills are Sanford Burnham Prebys Medical Discovery Institute will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionCompany DescriptionStrategic Insight delivers full service solutions to the asset management sector worldwide, including investment flow data, advisor sales analysis, in-depth research, analytics, editorial content and events for investment managers, asset owners and custodians, plus Transaction Cost Measurement of over 500 million trades per month. Our clients include over 1000 of the most prominent names in the asset management industry, including 83 of the worlds 100 largest fund managers.  Strategic Insight delivers its products and services through four distinct divisions: SI Data, SI Research, SI Intelligence and SI Interactive.  Our clients work with the Strategic Insight team because we provide both high-quality data on their business and a proven ability to help them analyze, internalize and discuss the real, strategic implications of that data. This unique combination has resulted in a business built on helping clients make informed decisions year after year that will improve their performance. Job Description The Data Operations team works with product clients to obtain, cleanse, and aggregate various data formats into Strategic Insights data systems. Once these objectives are met, the team generates actionable business intelligence and reporting from this dataset and delivers to clients. Individual Data Analyst members of this team will: Own client relationship as it relates to data processing and reporting:Communicate structure, quality, and delivery timelines regarding data transfer to and from clients.Deliver analysis to clients and modify standard reporting formats as necessary to meet clients technical requirements/limitations.Conduct data assessments using Excel, SQL, Spotfire, and other large dataset technology tools.Develop an expertise of our asset management industry data in order to help our clients understand their data and control data quality.Partner with client managers to develop custom data analyses requested by clients.Communicate and collaborate with our internal development team to coordinate ETL processing or raise awareness to identified findings.QualificationsYou have a bachelor's degree preferably in finance, economics, computer information systems or other business/data related field.Youve helped friends and family better utilize Microsoft Office programs because you understand what a disaster poorly formatted Excel documents can be, and youve occasionally been described by others as an Excel Wizard.You enjoy learning new ways to utilize and pair computer applications to make sense of datasets.You have previously worked with relational databases and you know your way around a basic SQL statement.You can write a concise and well organized email to your clients and colleagues.You are not easily stressed out when asked to rebalance your priorities to meet changing business conditions.You can juggle multiple client relationships at once without confusing contacts, conversations, and documents.You work well with others in a team environmentAdditional Information This is an excellent opportunity to join a very talented team in our San Diego office. Competitive salaryBenefits packages (Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k match, Flexible Spending accounts, company paid Life Insurance, and more)Paid time offOn-site gymHealthy Snacks Strategic Insight is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  This position is not eligible for work authorization/visa sponsorship.

Name: Product Analyst, Supply Chain Systems
Description: Job DescriptionProduct Analyst, Supply Chain Systems As the Product Analyst, Supply Chain Systems you will serve as a key support person for the Manager Supply Chain Systems and Product Owner of the Warehouse & Fulfillment Systems team. This position will focus on providing support, analysis, solutions research, and process improvement for supply chain systems and will support the supply chain operations team with developing and implementing supply chain best practices. What you will do: The Product Analyst, Supply Chain Systems will work with the supply chain and systems resources and other Product Analysts to support the development, testing, and implementation of systems and process changes. They will also be the primary owner and support person for the company's Warehouse Management System(s) portfolio (WMS), and will help lead the training and post go-live support for the business users and operations teams. This position will report directly to the Manager Supply Chain Systems and Processes. What you will contribute:Serve as the primary owner and support person for WMS used by all Supply Chain groups, this includes internal and external users.Support the supply chain systems manager and product owner in driving system enhancements and process improvement initiatives -- this role will focus on areas related to WMS and Inventory Management including reporting and configuration changes but will also provide support in other areas as needed.Gather, consolidate, document requirements for supply chain systems and translate them into technical needs.Work with and create SQL queries to support trouble shooting / triage activities. Own the support of escalated issues from issue prioritization, troubleshooting, resolution and communication and reference for future occurrences.Document current and future state business process flows including SOPs for Supply Chain Systems projects and initiatives. Translating system changes into process and operation changes and vice versa.Provide peak support for systems users, and help facilitate the triaging/issue resolution process in a fast paced environment.Provide analysis for new project requests or change requests.Develop and manage systems process design flows for supply chain systems projects.Specify and recommend configuration changes for supply chain systems enhancements and process improvements, and assist in gathering modification requests.Develop and modify and maintain critical reports utilizing the supply chain systems, and work with business users to develop, analyze, and measure KPIs.Work with QA leads to develop test use cases, approve test plans and execute testing and post go-live validation.Create release notes and other required documentation in support of deployment activities.Facilitate the onboarding process and training for new systems enhancements.Perform other duties that will be assignedWhat we offer:An environment of positive growth--where you can truly make a differenceThe blending of cultures across multiple cities and 3 continents where you can be part of helping shape our futureLines of business and a technology organization ready to embrace your role and the business value it bringsAn agile organization where you will spend time working across the organizationCareer opportunities! Those that have positive impact, with a positive approach, have a very bright future as we change, grow, expand and explore new and exciting experiences for our global customer baseWhat we seek:3+ years of demonstrated experience with Fulfillment and Warehouse Management Systems and Operation Process ImprovementBA/BS or higher degree in related field of studyAdvanced computer skills with Microsoft Office products (especially MS Excel, Visio and Analytics tools).Self-Starter with adept critical thinking, root cause analysis, problem solving, prioritization and time management skillsDemonstrated efficiency in both verbal and written communicationProficiency with SQL query usage and data analysis preferredExperience with Agile concepts and experience desiredSoftware QA testing (functional) experience a plusJob requires 10% to 20% travel (based in San Diego) Come join our team and be part of an exciting transformation! While you are part of the office of supply chain, you will have a broader impact on the overall growth of the business.  Come give FTD a look! This position will be based in San Diego, CA. We are an incredibly open and welcoming company--come join our family!  FTD Companies is a global premier floral and gifting company with a vision to be the leading and most trusted floral and gifting company in the world. We provide floral, specialty foods, gift and related products and services to consumers, retail florists, and other retail locations and companies in need of floral and gifting solutions.Company DescriptionFTD Companies, Inc. is a premier floral and gifting company. Through our diversified family of brands, we provide floral and gift products to consumers primarily in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland. We also provide floral products and services to retail florists and other retail locations throughout these same geographies. Our diversified portfolio of brands includes the following trademarks: Interflora, ProFlowers®, Shari's Berries®, Personal Creations, Cherry Moon Farms, Sincerely and Gifts.com.  FTD’s mission is to inspire, support and delight our customers when expressing life’s most important sentiments. We strive to be the leading and most trusted floral and gifting company in the world.

Ability to recognize and analyze salary history trends in order to make recommendations.Demonstrated skills to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.Ability to work in dynamic team environment demonstrating ARC Quality Standards: RESOURCEFULNESS: Ability to independently find quick and innovative ways to overcome challenges. Name: Commercial Credit Analyst
Description: The Business Lending Services Department specializes in lower middle-market commercial loans and commercial real estate loans throughout California. Name: IT Operations Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob #: 909406  Job Description: IT Operations Analyst (Finance). Please send resume to atbrown@apexsystems.com Our client is seeking exceptional individuals to add to its San Diego based Global IT Services Operations Team. The IT Operations Analyst position will partner with numerous functional areas including IT Management, IT Project Managers, Financial Planners / Analysts, Accounting, Procurement, and Audit teams to provide policy and procedural insights and improvement recommendations, as well as robust budget reporting, forecasts, and detailed cost / investment reporting. The IT Operations Analyst will also assist in the vendor management activities, daily purchasing setup and processing of POs, invoices, and project related financial management tools. Position also works daily with financial analyst counterparts focused on financial monitoring activities to ensure work meets stated service level agreements (SLAs) and financial objectives. The IT Operations Analyst is an exciting and diverse role with the Global IT Services organization focused on critical organizational processes and procedures impacting the entire IT team. We are actively seeking strong candidates with experience in IT technologies and financial operations to join our exciting and growing San Diego based team. Responsibilities:Plan and analyze financial process setup for internal projects, including both capital expenditures and operating expenses.Evaluate business cases to define benefits or return on investments for new and ongoing projects.Review and process purchase requests from several departments globallyEfficiently and accurately process purchase requests utilizing various applications/ tools, including ERP and vendor portals.Request price quotes from suppliers. Utilize country specific suppliers/ approved vendors.Ensure all materials are purchased on time per predefined specificationManage and assign end user/desktop software licenses. Perform annual true-up of licenses with vendor.Track and provide notification of eligible hardware refreshes globally.Monitor orders and follow up on the receipt of goods and/or services.Monitor ongoing spend and costs of outsourced services/vendors.Code invoices for processing by accounts payables; perform invoice to purchase order matching and reconcile any discrepancies.Correspond (verbal & written) with internal and external contacts; end users, commodities management, accounts payables and vendors.Creates and maintains working IT operations process documentation.Create and maintains operational processing Service Level Agreements with internal stakeholders.Assist in the continuous improvement of the IT procurement process.Work with internal audit team to perform targeted IT operational audits and remediation plans.Create operating reports on IT investments and budgets.Assist in vendor negotiations and selection.Assist in periodic audits of IT on invoice, payment terms and expected performance results.Qualifications:Bachelors Degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration; equivalent work experience in a Business or Financial Field2-4 years of Financial Planning and Analysis Experience1-3 years supporting a Technology OrganizationSolid understanding of Project Accounting/Job Cost Accounting processes and how they are used to manage technology investmentsAbility to drive solutions, present alternatives and reach a consensus to support operational needs within budgetClear communication skills both written and verbalTechnical requirements: Business Process Improvement Experience Oracle ERP, ServiceNow, SalesForce, FinancialForce, Power BI, Workday Experience Knowledge of Infrastructure, Networking, Telecommunication services Proficient in the use of MS products (e.g. Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams, and SharePoint) EEO EmployerApex is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at 844-463-6178* Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration; equivalent work experience in a Business or Financial Field * 2-4 years of Financial Planning and Analysis Experience * 1-3 years supporting a Technology Organization * Solid understanding of Project Accounting/Job Cost Accounting processes and how they are used to manage technology investments * Ability to drive solutions, present alternatives and reach a consensus to support operational needs within budget * Clear communication skills both written and verbal Technical requirements: Business Process Improvement Experience Oracle ERP, ServiceNow, SalesForce, FinancialForce, Power BI, Workday Experience Knowledge of Infrastructure, Networking, Telecommunication services Proficient in the use of MS products (e.g. Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams, and SharePoint)

Ability to lead and facilitate effective group activities with poise and confidence.Experience leading collaborative teamwork. Ability to interact with others using tact, diplomacy and confidence. Ability to organize confidential documents, employee records, financial information and business office materials with efficiency and accuracy.  Ability to maintain computerized and paper records and filing systems for rapid retrieval while maintaining accuracy. Name: Financial Analyst I
Description: Requisition Number 18-0197  Post Date 11/28/2018  Title Financial Analyst I  City San Marcos  State CA  Description We are a global leader in the irrigation, outdoor lighting, dispensing technology, and custom manufacturing industries. Driving our continued success is the combined energy and talents of the nearly 3,000 people on our team. Together, we create a diverse array of products that can be seen all over the world, from residential landscapes to national landmarks, stadiums, parks, hotels, and municipal buildings. Although we’re global, we’re family owned, and our casual, fun, and caring company culture is what makes this a special place to work. As we grow, we are dedicated to preserving our unique culture that makes our employees proud to work here. Whether you’re pursuing a career at our headquarters in Southern California, or an opportunity at one of our state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities, or something somewhere in between, we look forward to welcoming you to Hunter Industries and our Family of Companies.  About this Role: The Financial Analyst I is responsible for providing management with the financial analysis of key operating results. Responsibilities include business unit analysis and control, forecast modeling, financial reporting, Key Performance Indicators (KPI) development and reporting, and forecast development. Demonstrates behavior that is consistent with the company’s values of Customer Satisfaction, Innovation, Family, and Social Responsibility. Essential Job Functions/Tasks:  1.Provides analysis with business partners to support decisions with critical business impact (capital expenditures, net present value (NPV), process improvements, etc.). 2. Assists in implementing performance measures which focus on key business drivers that support long term performance and strategic initiatives. 3. Performs monthly activities in support of period review, forecasts, and month-end results. 4. Acts as a business partner for Sales, General, and Administration leaders with focus on sales, marketing, R&D, and administration. 5. Analyzes emerging businesses for profitability, capital requirements, and return on investments.  6. Provides comparison of actual results to forecast and analysis of variances. 7. Assists in building complex financial reports and dashboards that provide comprehensive information to the end users.  8. Completes ad-hoc financial analysis and special projects to assist management in understanding business performance; financial modeling. 9. Assists in preparing the short-term and long-term operating plan, including accumulation of data from variance departments. Other Job Functions:  Performs other related tasks as assigned, some of which may become essential to the position.  Hunter Industries’ approach to the health and safety of each employee is based on adherence to our Injury and Illness Prevention Program (IIPP). Every employee is responsible for their safety and must work safely at all times. Employees are to immediately report all unsafe or hazardous conditions, including injuries and near misses to their Supervisor, Environmental Health & Safety Department, or Workers Compensation Manager. Those employees who do not comply with safe work practices may be subject to disciplinary action, up to and including termination.  Requirements Education/Training Required:  Bachelor’s in Finance or Accounting or equivalent work experience.  Experience Required:  Minimum two years of finance experience.  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSA's): KSA #1: Proficient in the use of computers including Microsoft office products.  KSA #2: Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and the ability to interact with members across the organization. KSA #3: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. KSA #4: Ability to work under minimal supervision, to self-initiate activities, and to organize workload to meet deadlines. KSA #5: Requires ability to set goals and objectives and to set and meet timelines to achieve goals and objectives. KSA #6: Flexible and able to adapt to changing organizational needs in a fast-paced environment. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSA's) Preferred: KSA #7: Knowledge of ERP software such as MAS, JDE, Oracle, SAP as well as experience with AS400 and queries preferred.  KSA #8: Knowledge of budgeting software such as Hyperion, Cognos, and SAP. KSA #9: Strong technical skills and knowledge of Microsoft Excel including the ability to use a variety of functions (Lookups, Sumifs, and Pivoting) and to create detailed financial models.  Physical Demands: Ability to sit for extended periods of time.  Intermittent walking to gain access to work areas.  Ability to climb stairs to gain access to work area.  Finger dexterity sufficient to use a computer for long periods of time and to complete paperwork activities. Visual acuity sufficient to use a computer, to read written materials and to complete paperwork activities. Hearing sufficient to communicate with individuals by telephone and in person.  Ability to bend, lift and carry books, files and office supplies and other items weighing up to 20 pounds.  Work Environment:  Office setting with temperature controls. Follow us on LinkedIn, check out our rave reviews on Glassdoor, and learn more about our company culture on our career site: http://corporate.hunterindustries.com/careers

Name: Program Analyst
Description: Job Number: R0043386 Program Analyst, MidThe Challenge:  Are you searching for a position where you can use your program analysis skills to make a difference? A program requires a significant investment of limited resources across multiple projects. With that level of complexity, you need a skilled program analyst examining how those resources are used and keeping the program on the path to success. Thats why we need you, a program analyst who can ensure success through careful analysis and effective communication.  We have an opportunity for a program analyst to join our team as we develop the next generation of data link systems to support US and Allied Armed Forces. Youll monitor cost, schedule, and performance of multiple projects, using tools like Microsoft Office tools, TOPvue, SharePoint, etc. and regular interactions with subject matter experts, government customers, systems integrators, and other analysts. The real power of program analysis comes from communication, so youll create status updates, briefs, and schedule and drive discussions and review and make experience-based recommendations for improvement to program leadership. We focus on growing as a team, so youll share your expertise with other analysts through leadership and mentoring. This is a chance to directly improve the government customers by developing program strategy and eliminating risks across projects. Join us and help make sure our key customer program stays on-time and within budget as we improve warfighter communications systems.  Empower change with us. Build Your Career: Consulting at Booz Allen means empowering you to provide your customers with the best support. With a consulting career at Booz Allen, you can expect: a large business consulting communityaccess to experts in virtually every fielda culture that focuses on supporting our employees We have opportunities that provide stability while offering variety, so you can find the right fit for your career and your life. Youll also have access to a wealth of training resources through our Consulting University, an online learning portal where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications? Take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site courses, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. Well help you develop the career you want, as you chart your own course for success. With contracts across the globe in multiple industries, no matter where you want to go with your consulting career, we have the path the takes you there. You Have: -4+ years of experience with government contracts management  -Experience in a Government Acquisition Program Office  -Experience with Microsoft Office applications  -Secret clearance  -BA or BS degree Nice If You Have: -Experience with interpreting and consolidating various team member reviews of Basis of Estimates in various technical proposals  -Experience in reviewing technical documents and contract data requirements list items to ensure compliance with various delivery orders  -Experience in drafting, editing, and tracking acquisition products with minimal direction, including government letters, statements of work, contract data requirements list items, request for proposal packages, monthly status reports or terminal deliveries, fair opportunity exemptions, and program briefs  -Experience with managing correspondence, including drafting, routing, and tracking responses  -Experience with drafting approval or rejection letters and technical direction letters  -Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills  -Possession of excellent interpersonal skills appropriate to work in a large multi-national program office  -MBA, MA, or MS degree  -Federal Acquisition Regulations Training  -Business or Program Management Certification  -Defense Acquisition University Acquisition Level II or equivalent certification Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.  Were an EOE that empowers our peopleno matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or veteran statusto fearlessly drive change.NMC

Name: Systems Analyst
Description: HHSA Behavioral Health Services (BHS) is seeking a dedicated Systems Analyst to work with BHS Inpatient Health Services (IHS) San Diego County Psychiatry Hospital (SDCPH) and BHS Edgemoor Skilled Nursing Facility and the HHSA Pharmacy on a shared full-time basis. As a Systems Analyst (SA), this individual will, at a minimum, be working with individuals from the Health and Human Services Information Technology Services (ITS) division, the San Diego County Information Technology Outsourcing Contractor (DXC Technology) (DXC)), and third party vendors to assist BHS with related projects.  The BA/SA will collaborate with clients, vendors, teammates, and other teams to meet customer, regulatory and Information Systems infrastructure requirements for application implementations and upgrades. In addition, the SA will analyze system problems, use creativity to provide viable solutions, execute detailed test plans, create thorough documentation, and conduct peer reviews. A diverse customer base includes clinical and support staff, management, and physicians. The SA is a critical link between systems, technology resources, teams, departments, and operational healthcare staff and leadership professionals. They are an advocate for the clinician and business leaders translating clinical and business standards and requirements into technical specifications. The SA provides expertise and support to highly visible, sensitive, and multi-faceted initiatives. They are responsible for the successful turnover of projects and requests to production. In addition, the SA:  • Evaluates the existing information processing systems or manual work flows to evaluate effectiveness and recommend changes to improve production or workflow as required Provides recommendations for the most efficient and cost-effective solutionsAssists with the implementation of software application systems and insures stakeholders are engaged and/or kept informed, as desired, throughout the projectWorks closely with BHS staff, developers, testers and a variety of end users to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfactionMaintains current applications and interfaces to ensure updates/corrections are completed as necessaryTests and troubleshoots routine applications and recommends and/or implements solutions  • Minimum Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or closely related fieldFive years’ experience administering, testing, maintaining medical information systems or knowledge of clinician workflow analysisUnderstanding of health care patient administration, clinical, and business systems and computer-based hospital systems to include: process and workflow analysis, systems/applications analysis, project lifecycle implementationImplementation and upgrade experience with previous integrated Healthcare Information Systems with emphasis on EHR applications/systems (Cerner, NTTData, etc.).Experience with pharmacy systems (Etreby, Millennium, PharmNet, Pyxis, Prodigy, etc.)Experience with healthcare/hospital workforce schedulers and interfaces with State systems (Kronos, In-house spreadsheets, etc.)Experience with inventory systemsExperience with incident reporting systemsMust possess skills and experience in oral and written communications. This is applicable to analysis, documentation, application/systems specifications, project preparation, risk identification and escalation. Ability to present to a broad spectrum of individuals and groups including senior management, physicians and health care professionals.Demonstrated level of integrity and trust, capable of maintaining confidential information.Demonstrated ability to perform in a matrixed team environment, utilize effective team relationship skills, and interact at all levels of the organization.Knowledge in fundamentals of hospital organization, Joint Commission, HIPAA, CMS regulations and guidelines and relevant California regulation (e.g., Title 22, Title 28) requirements. Demonstrated ability to research complex regulatory requirements.  Optional Skills:Knowledge and experience with State and Local Government programs, preferably in the Healthcare and/or social services.

Name: Program Cost Scheduling & Control Analyst 2
Description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems in air and space that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our work preserves freedom and democracy, and advances human discovery and our understanding of the universe. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have a lot of fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.In support of the Product Support IPT, you will prepare and coordinate the plans and schedules for new or existing programs. You will determine, monitor, and review costs, operational budgets, schedules, and manpower requirements. You will analyze effects of projects upon the labor pool to determine the most practical and cost-efficient methods to obtain the required resources. You will assess the progress against established plans and parameters. You will formulate and recommend corrective action measures such as schedule revisions, manpower adjustments, fund allocations, and work requirements. All of these support processes are executed using the EVMS tools developed by the IPT EVMS planning team and/or thoserequired by the HALE Enterprise program offices.Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree and 3 years' experience in providing support in a budget management environment or a Master's Degree with 1 year of experience.Proficient in EVMS and MS Office Suite of tools: Excel, Word and PowerPoint. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelors degree in business, finance, math or related degree. Proficient in MPM, Business Warehouse and SAP. Good communications skills and the ability to work well in a team environment.  Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Name: Configuration Management Analyst (Level TBD)
Description: Are you a process-oriented Configuration Management (CM) Analyst with strong Microsoft Office skills and a talent for paying attention to detail? If selected, you will review documentation or product plans to determine configuration and data management requirements for the electronic products that we design and manufacture.Basic duties include:Assign part numbers and revision levels in the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.Review design release documents for completeness, accuracy, proper authorizations, and updates.Incorporate and maintain bills of materials (BOM) in the ERP system.Assign Engineering Change Order (ECO) numbers, review ECOs for content, completeness, and format.Distribute proposed design changes to Configuration Control Board (CCB) members, chair the CCB meeting, and incorporate ECOs in the ERP system.Prepare data requirements list submittals and transmit to customers in accordance with contract requirements.Bachelor's degree in business or technical discipline preferred, or equivalent experience required.Experience in configuration management is required.Excellent organizational and time management skills and attention to details are a necessity.Strong written and verbal communication skills are required.Proficiency with MS Word and Excel required. Adobe Acrobat experience is desired.Must have strong customer service ethics and attention to detail.LN ERP systems experience and software CM experience would be a plus.This position requires the ability to obtain a Secret clearance.About Us L3 Telemetry & RF Products, located in San Diego, is a full service manufacturer of state-of-the-art communication and telemetry solutions for space, airborne, terrestrial and maritime applications. Our integrated solutions combine latest-generation technologies and proven processes and are provided to defense, intelligence and government agencies, as well as international and commercial organizations. We partner with customers, industry and academia to develop innovations that reduce costs and improve performance.  We offer competitive benefits and an alternate Fridays off schedule. Do you have what it takes to be L3? If so, please apply now; we’re anxious to hear from you!  For more information, visit our division’s web site at: www.L3T.com/TRF. Equal Opportunity Employer – minorities / females / veterans / individuals with disabilities / sexual orientation / gender identity.

Name: Junior-Mid Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAtlas Executive Consulting, LLC (Atlas), has an exciting opportunity for a Junior-Mid Financial Analyst supporting our client engagements within the federal government. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with superior listening, communication, and analytical talents. This position serves an important role in supporting a team of business professionals and will be responsible for processing and tracking various types of Government documents and recording the transactions in the accounting system Responsibilities:Managing requirements from internal and external stakeholdersPreparing and executing funding actions in various financial systems and tracking the status of those functionsMerging disparate data from multiple sources (Excel, SAP, etc.)Performing meaningful analysis and communicating the results effectively to customersConducting process analysis of financial planning, programming and budgeting activities and developing recommendations for process improvement as neededCollaborating in a team-oriented environment, communicating complex analyses verbally and in writing, developing innovative approaches to solving technical challenges, and managing tasks related to government resources and acquisitionAbility to manage multiple tasks, and completing priorities to assess ad hoc requests as well as performing regular taskingsSupporting development of client financial reports. Writing and presentating results and analysis to client management.Performing other duties as assigned.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelors degree in business, finance, statistics, analytics ore related field is requiredIntermediate-Advanced user with Microsoft Office products (i.e., Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).Excellent oral and written communication skills.Proven time management and organizational skills.DoD Security Clearance.Preferred Qualifications:Prior Navy financial experienceActive secret clearance Instructions to Apply: Please apply via our online portal. Thank you for your interest!  Atlas, www.atlasexecutive.com, is a Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business specializing in business management consulting to the Department of Defense and other Federal Agencies. Atlas was recently named one of Consulting Magazines 2017 seven Small Jewels, highlighting the growth and innovation the firm brings to market. In 2016, Atlas was named the #1 best midsize business to work for in San Diego and is considered one of the fastest growing businesses in South Carolina by the SC business news.  Atlas is an EEO/AA/Disability/VETS Employer. Hiring, promotion, transfer, compensation, benefits, discipline, termination and all other employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, national origin, citizenship/immigration status, veteran status or any other protected status. Atlas will not make any posting or employment decision that does not comply with applicable laws relating to labor and employment, equal employment opportunity, employment eligibility requirements or related matters. Nor will Atlas require, in a posting or otherwise, U.S. citizenship or lawful permanent residency in the U.S. as a condition of employment except as necessary to comply with law, regulation, executive order, or federal, state or local government contract.

Name: Research & Planning Analyst
Description: Posting Details (Default Section) Closing Date: 01/07/2019 Open Until Filled No Classification Title Research & Planning Analyst Working Title Research & Planning Analyst Recruitment Limits Location District Pay Information Range 13 ($5,822.39 – $9,720.72) per month based on the current Supervisory and Professional Employees’ Association – Salary Schedule A Initial salary placement is commensurate with related experience and promotional rules. The District offers a comprehensive fringe benefit package including employer paid: medical, dental, and vision plans; sick and vacation leave; and opportunities for professional development. Initial Salary Placement, Promoted or transferred employees will be placed as specified in the SPAA – Supervisory & Professional Administrators Association Handbook. This position is FLSA exempt and may not accrue overtime. A temporary probationary period will be applied to the employee entering this assignment. The SDCCD Employment Web Page provides a link to employee collective bargaining agreements and handbooks, and more information about terms and conditions of employment to include salary and benefits.Position Equivalent FTE: 1.0 FTENo. Months: 12 Months Position Number: 00120177 FLSA Status Exempt (does not accrue overtime) Position Type Classified Bargaining Unit Supervisory Range 13 Department Institutional Research The Position Applications are currently being accepted for Research & Planning Analyst in the Office of Institutional Research and Planning, located at District Office. Hours are Monday thru Friday 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. This position is under the Supervisory and Professional Administrator Association which does not accrue overtime, and may require working evenings. Selected candidate must be willing to adjust work days/hours based on the department’s needs. Please note that an employee may be transferred to any site at the option of the Chancellor.Classification Description Click here for description If you would like to open the link in a different tab or window, right click and select the option.Desired Qualifications - Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university in any relevant field with an emphasis on research or management. - Advanced research techniques and methodologies, including both quantitative and qualitative methods. - Any combination of training and experience equivalent to: three (4) years of professional level experience conducting research studies and/or analysis of information.  - Ability to evaluate data in order to provide leadership with planning recommendations for institutional decision making. - Strong report writing and presentation skills. - Demonstrated effective communication skills: analysis, synthesis and ability to convey research to audiences with varying levels of familiarity with data by “telling the story” behind research findings.  - Knowledge of California Community College system or higher education legislation and practices.  - Knowledge of enrollment management practices in higher education.  - Knowledge of survey instruments design and survey platforms; experience summarizing and analyzing results. - Proficiency applying statistical knowledge to research designs and using statistical packages. e.g.: SPSS, R Studio, SAS, Stata, etc. - Experience designing and performing data visualizations and using data visualization software. e.g.: Tableau, Power BI (Business Intelligence), etc. - Strong competencies in time management and project management skills. - Familiarity and knowledge of database extraction, usage, data element dictionaries maintenance and experience using data extraction software such as: Hyperion, SQL, etc. - Able to adapt to fast paced data and research request environment.Foreign Degree: Applicants with foreign degrees from colleges or universities outside of the United States must have their coursework evaluated by a professional association that is a member of the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services (NACES). A copy of the evaluation must be submitted with your on-line application.Commitment to Diversity: All applicants must have demonstrated cultural competency and sensitivity to and understanding of the diverse academic, socioeconomic, cultural, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, and ethnic backgrounds of community college students and staff.Special Instructions to Applicants: To ensure full consideration, qualified candidates must submit a complete online application that includes the items listed (extraneous material will not be reviewed). References to résumés or other uploaded documents within the online application will be considered an “incomplete” application; please enter “N/A” if any section does not apply. Complete online application; Cover Letter not to exceed 3 pages describing credentials, background and experience related to the duties and responsibilities of the position; Resume not to exceed 2 pages (emphasizing experience, education, publications or presentations, if any); AND Three Professional References listed within the application.Important: Only complete application packets will be forwarded to the committee. Applicants must complete each required field and answer each supplemental question; references to resumes, CVs, etc. will not substitute for completing the required fields and supplemental questions; and will result in the application being considered “incomplete.” To ensure consistency and fairness to all candidates, please do not submit materials other than those requested (i.e., personal photo, articles you’ve written, etc). Please only upload requested documents using respective document name labels. Uploading extraneous materials, unless specifically requested within this posting, may result in your application not being reviewed.  Before submitting the application and uploaded materials, please check to make sure they are complete and accurate. Once you submit, you will not have access to your application to make changes, however you will be able to view the application if submitted prior to the deadline. If you think you have made an error prior to the closing date, please contact HR at (619) 388-6579 or email jobs@sdccd.edu.Application materials sent via mail, fax, or e-mail will not be accepted.Note that correspondence, including interview invitations, will be sent to you via the same e-mail used to submit the application: it is the applicant’s responsibility to frequently check their email for correspondence.All inquiries, nominations and applications will be held in the strictest confidenceConditions of Employment: SELECTED CANDIDATE IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING PRIOR TO EMPLOYMENT:Submit “official” transcripts as stated on application (From all institutions listed in the online application); Pass a pre-employment physical exam at the District’s expense; Provide a Tuberculosis Clearance Certificate for initial appointment (Note: The certificate must be renewed every 4 years as a condition of continuing employment); Have fingerprints taken by a Live Scan computer at the candidate’s expense (Clearance must be received prior to first day of employment); Present original documents for proof of eligibility to work in the United States  as required by the I9 Employment Eligibility Verification form; ANDAttend a new hire processing appointment in Human Resources located at the District Administrative Offices.EMPLOYMENT AFTER RETIREMENT If you accept a contract (permanent) position with SDCCD and are a retired annuitant with CalPERS or CalSTRS, you must reinstate from your retirement system. Please reference the CalPERS or CalSTRS website for further information.Additional Information: EMPLOYEE BENEFITS SDCCD provides a comprehensive fringe benefit package for its full-time classified employees. The District contributes toward the cost of the premium (including dependent coverage) for the medical insurance plan options. Additional benefits include dental, vision, sick leave, vacation and opportunities for professional development. Contract employees become members of the California Public Employees’ Retirement System (CalPERS) upon appointment.Posting Number CL01071

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Data Analyst Imagine what you could accomplish if you could drive positive change every single day. At ResMed, you can find out. As the leader in sleep and respiratory disorder solutions, our work changes lives with every breath.  Digital Health Technology team powers digital experiences and engagement to enhance the lives of millions of people every day through connected care. We build, deliver and manage a portfolio of data management platforms and mobile offerings in support of our core businesses. We thrive on simple and elegant architecture and agility. You'll be immersed in a dynamic high-growth environment and empowered to excel, take informed risks, and drive ingenuity across the enterprise. Let's talk about the team and you: We are currently seeking applications for the role of Data Analyst to work in our Digital Health Technology Team to design and develop the data systems to ensure Operations team members have the product, support, and operations data they need to make crucial decisions. As a Data Analyst, you'll have the opportunity to design innovative data solutions and solve challenging problems using ResMed's large-scale production data infrastructure. In addition you will design and implement Machine Learning solutions for operations teams.  Responsibilities will also include:  Designing and implement Machine Learning solutions for operation teams.Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed, and conduct an end-to-end analysis.Design, build, launch, optimize, and extend full-stack data and operational intelligence solutions spanning extraction, storage, transformation, development and visualization.Collaborate with operations data to identify the underlying drivers of the data.Configure, test and debug reporting solutions and data pipelines, specifically in the AWS platform.Utilize knowledge to make predictions and solve Machine Learning Challenges.Let's talk qualifications and experience:Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent working experience in a Data Analyst role with a dev/operations backgroundExperience in relational and non-relational databases.Experience with data analysis techniques.Experience with Python.Experience with AWS technologies (e.g. Kinesis, S3, Glue, SageMaker, Lambda, QuickSight).Experience in creating and applying advanced statistical methods and machine learning techniques such as: dimensionality reduction strategies, regression, classification, clustering, simulation, scenario analysis, neural networks, and decision trees.OK, so what next? At ResMed, we believe in supporting, inspiring and developing our people. So, we recruit the best and then give them the tools to make a real difference in the lives of our patients. We believe that fresh thinking inspires innovation - and our shared success. If this sounds like a place you would like to work and you have the drive to transform and enhance the lives of millions of patients through your contribution at work, then today is your day! Apply now!  #LI-NF1  Please note: Unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  ResMed is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/ Female/ Disability/ Veterans  ResMed participates in E-Verify. The Notice of E-Verify Participation and the Notice of Right to Work are available for your review.  ResMed is a smoke-free workplace.

Name: Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst - 6 Months
Description: PURPOSE OF THIS JOB The Senior BI Analyst is responsible for gathering BI requirements, work with BI Development team to develop the solution, participate in testing the application and then train the users to ensure that deployment of the application is successful. This requires a comprehensive understanding of the various BI implementation methodologies, business knowledge across the organization, great communication and inter-personal skills to deploy BI solution effectively and efficiently for better decisions. MAJOR ACTIVITIES TO ENSURE ACHIEVEMENT OF KEY RESULTS AND DELIVERABLESWork Independently or as a member of a development group, performs system analysis, design, programming, testing, documentation, installation, user training and system maintenance and support.Consults with user management and staff throughout all stages of the development cycle to ensure that systems achieve the user's business objectives.Develops systems observing professional system design concepts and office standards and conventions.Assists users in the definition of their business objectives relative to automation and development of system specifications.Provides maintenance programming services required to maintain current and operational systemsWork with IT team members to develop the solution.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEBA or BS degree in an Information Systems discipline or applicable business related field developing the required knowledge and skills, or equivalent experience.Five plus years of progressively responsible experience in analysis, development, implementation and support of business information systems, and direct technical support of end-users, preferably in the Healthcare IndustryFive years of experience in Business Intelligence preferably in Cognos BIKnowledge of SQL, BI architecture, relational and dimensional modeling and experience working in data warehouse environment.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Strong interpersonal skills; ability to work cooperatively and effectively with others.Strong analytic and problem-solving ability.Preferred, Knowledge of Infor-LN ERPPreferred, Knowledge of Salesforce.comEducation: Bachelors Degree Job Type: Contract  Experience: System Design: 5 years (Required)ERP Systems: 1 year (Preferred)Business Intelligence: 5 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required)

Name: Risk Analyst

(GA-ASI), an affiliate of General Atomics, is a world leader in proven, reliable remotely piloted aircraft and tactical reconnaissance radars, as well as advanced high-resolution surveillance systems. No Title Risk Analyst Job QualificationsTypically requires a bachelor's or master's degree in accounting or a related discipline and four or more years of progressive experience in accounting with a bachelor's degree, three years of experience with a master's degree, two years Big 4 auditing experience, and must be a CPA candidate.Must have demonstrated ability to apply concepts and principles of accounting to develop solutions to a variety or problems along with computer literacy and knowledge of operations and applications pertinent to the field.Must have good interpersonal skills and communication abilities that enable effective interface with staff members in developing accounting documentation and in making presentations.Must be proficient in Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.Able to work extended hours as required.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job Number: R0040967 Data Analyst, MidKey Role:  Provide analytical and reporting support to Navy clients. Work closely with a variety of clients to capture and document business requirements, analyze data collection plans and normalization processes, and develop queries to extract accurate and timely business information from existing data environments. Employ expertise in data analysis to create solutions through the application of appropriate analytical techniques and methods. Analyze lasting technical solutions that leverage prevailing analytical tools, including Microsoft Access and Excel with a focus on effective integration and sustainability. Work on multiple projects with simultaneous deadlines and perform duties in fast-paced environments, as necessary. This position is located in San Diego, CA.  Basic Qualifications:  -3+ years of experience with business data analytics  -Experience with Microsoft Excel for business modeling  -Knowledge of Microsoft Access, including tables, queries, and forms  -Knowledge of Visual Basic for Applications (VBA)  -Knowledge of Tableau  -Knowledge of SQL  -Secret clearance  -BA or BS degree  Additional Qualifications:  -Experience with Business Objects Web Intelligence (Web-i)  -Experience with PowerBI or Qlikview  -Experience with SPSS, SAS, MiniTab, or JMP  -Experience with machine learning data science techniques  -Experience with the Navy ERP  -Experience with working in a Navy program office  -Experience with DoD PPBE processes for any military branch  -Experience with Python Pandas and R or R Studio  Clearance:  Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.  Were an EOE that empowers our peopleno matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or veteran statusto fearlessly drive change.NMC

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Overview Company Overview: Public Consulting Group, Inc. (PCG) is a $400 million, fast growing, for profit company providing management consulting and technology services to help public sector education, health, human services, and other government clients achieve their performance goals and better serve populations in need. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, PCG has more than 2200 professionals in 47 offices throughout the U.S, in Montreal, Canada, London, England and Lodz, Poland. The firm draws on more than two decades of consulting to public sector clients in all 50 states, Canada and the EU to deliver best-practice solutions and measurable results to state and local public agencies, health plans, insurance departments, and private providers that do business with government agencies. PCG is committed to a diverse workforce which is a reflection of our clients and the people they serve. Our organizational culture attracts and rewards people who are results-oriented and interested in making an immediate impact on their community as well as their own career. Responsibilities Overall Responsibilities  PCG is seeking highly motivated and dependable Data Analyst with an interest in public service to be part of the training team for the San Diego CalWORKs/Refugee/Child Care and Payments Project for the South, Central, and East Regions of San Diego County.  This role will be responsible for creating and distributing reports and data throughout the organization with the final goal of ensuring that all departments meet or exceed the contractual measures. The Data Analyst will generate these reports utilizing existing reporting database. This person will be empowered to create new solutions to improve the efficiency of data gathering and the adoption of its use throughout the organization. The Data Analyst will identify trends and highlight those to leaders and staff members.  Specific Responsibilities Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reportsPartner with the database team to improve data collection, integrity and analyticsAcquire data from primary or secondary data sourcesIdentify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data setsFilter and "clean" data to locate and correct problemsWork with management to prioritize business and information needsLocate and define new process improvement opportunitiesSeek feedback and direction from project leadership teamCommunicate data trends in writing, meetings and reportsFulfill other project related duties as assigned; and Maintain positive working relationships with all staff and customers.Qualifications R Required Skills  Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst Technical expertise regarding data models, data mining and segmentation techniques Some knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc) Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings Comfortable creating and explaining polished reports targeted at all staff levels. Must have competent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to recognize and maintain the confidentiality of all materials in the work setting. Ability to work across all levels of management and staff. Display a professional level of empathy for participants and respect for cultural differences. Required Education and Experience  A Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics strongly preferred At least 1 year of experience as a data analyst Ability to travel between offices in El Cajon, San Diego, and Chula Vista.

Name: Compensation & Benefits Analyst
Description: SUMMARY Working in conjunction with divisions and subsidiary companies to support corporate requirements, this position is responsible for implementation and maintenance of compensation and benefits programs for the Kyocera International Inc. Group Companies. Also supports the ongoing administration of Human Resources Information Systems to support short and long-range Human Resources goals. Ensures compliance with corporate policies and pertinent federal and state laws. Participates in the research, analysis, development/revision, and implementation of employee benefit programs and compensation programs that are designed to maintain company objectives and competitive position in the marketplace. Leads various project teams and participates in management meetings to establish strategic plans and objectives. Produces high level analysis of compensation and employee demographics data. REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's degree in Human Resources or a related field, with HR certification  A minimum of 5 or more years of related experience  Advanced working knowledge of Excel and data analysis  Intermediate working knowledge of HRIS systems (UltiPro preferred) KEY RESPONSIBILITIESProvides immediate information for major strategic projects to a wide level of users (Executives, Manager, Vendor, etc)Working in concert with teams from all subsidiary companies recommends, proposes, negotiates approval, and implements policies, procedures, or programs in the areas of compensation and benefits. May adapt plans to accommodate different cultures, business practices, or customs. Works with subsidiary companies to ensure programs are current with regard to trends, practices and costs.Communicates and interfaces with employees and benefit plan consultants, vendors, legal advisors, and administrators regarding benefit policies, plans, eligibility and coverage issues, and enrollment procedures.Maintains relationships with HRIS software and hardware vendors, and works with subsidiary companies to ensure the development of proper training and documentation for system use and maintenanceEstablishes data tables, structures, files, interface requirements and data integrity protocols for ongoing administrationDevelops drafts for budgetary plans.Oversees the specification, development and implementation of new or redesigned systems, reports and policies and procedures for internal use.Implements all HRIS based requirement for benefits, vendors, mass updates and performance management tools into HRIS.Perform any other related duties as required or assigned. Kyocera International, Inc. values diversity in its workforce, and is proud to be an AAP/EEO employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.
