Name: Systems Analyst III 18
Description: Relocation Available AUSGAR Technologies, Inc., an EOE Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans employer, is a rapidly growing Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) Department of Defense, government contractor with core competencies in Information Assurance, Cyber Security and Systems Engineering. With offices on both the East and West coasts, an inviting culture, and above-standard benefits, opportunity abounds for the right individual! Systems Analyst III 18-042Job Description: As a growing Department of Defense Contractor, AUSGAR Technologies is expanding its workforce and has an opening for a Systems Analyst III.  The Systems Analyst III supports SPAWAR in the coordination and execution of Systems Engineering Technical Reviews (SETR) for programs and projects under the Program Executive Officer (PEO) Command, Control, Communications, Computers, and Intelligence (C4I) and the PEO Enterprise Information Systems (EIS). The Systems Analyst is a technical expert who provides guidance and oversight to acquisition organizations and domain-specific advice to Navy leadership to influence the technical strategies, procedures and plans to implement Information Dominance (ID) transformational tenets across C4I and EIS. Responsibilities include:Provides technical expertise for critical technical processes such as systems engineering, interoperability, technology transition, and technical standards.Serve as the technical coordinator for all SETR activities, including the application of SETR Readiness Assessments (SRAs); tailoring Action Plans (APs); coordinating Kick-off Meetings; developing draft Pre-Close-out assessments; coordinating the process of Risk and Issue Management; and completion of SETR events via recommendation packages, incorporation of best practices and ongoing process improvement.Enhance TA SE support by assisting and reviewing Navy acquisition efforts through facilitating independent technical input, support, and evaluation for program products, platforms, and processes throughout the acquisition lifecycle from concept to disposal. This is accomplished through SETR for product and platform risk assessments that provide comprehensive engineering analyses resulting in insight, predictability and an improved understanding of cost, schedule and performance risk to DoN products and platforms.Ensures the programs develop designs that are aligned to the ID Enterprise Architecture (IDEA).Understanding of SETR processes, best practices and ISO/IEC 15288 concepts.Knowledge of net-centric engineering principles (i.e., networking, communications, services, data and information assurance) to facilitate technical assistance and assessment to acquisition and engineering organizations.Ability to coordinate with others and explain the SETR process to those who are unfamiliar with this type of technical review.Ability to write well and provide finished deliverables to customers.Review of program documentation, plans, reports, etc. to determine if the program is on the right path to meet technical/programmatic requirements, follows proper policies and procedures, risks associated with software development, budget, schedule, systems/enterprise integration.Document and provide independent assessment reports.Total Years of Related Experience for Position: 5-9 years of related technical/engineering experience. Job Requirements:BS Degree in Engineering/Scientific discipline from accredited college/university or equivalent years of experience.5-9 years of Navy C4I experience.DAWIA Certification in Systems Planning, Research, Development, and Engineering or INCOSE CSEP with 5 years systems analysis/engineering preferred.Must be proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel).Must possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent written and verbal communications skills.Applicant must be able to work in both a team environment and independently with minimal supervision.Ability to travel as needed ( 10%).Active Security Clearance (Secret or above) is required. TS/SCI clearance preferred. AUSGAR Technologies, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. AUSGAR Technologies, Inc. is committed to engaging in affirmative action to increase employment opportunities for females, minorities, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. We are an EOE - Minorities/Females/Disabled/VeteransJob Posted by ApplicantPro

Name: Delivery Analyst
Description: Founded by a team of data experts, VizExplorer is a highly-differentiated analytics and business intelligence leader, applying design and visualization principles to big data problems. With analytics, data visualization, and operational intelligence solutions, VizExplorer makes enterprise data actionable, delivering insights to optimize efficiency and profitability. As a market leader in the Casino Gaming industry, VizExplorer products maximize revenue and profits, making marketing and casino floor configuration recommendations based on analysis of a myriad of disparate and varied consumer databases and systems of record; VizExplorer provides critically important technology to more than 250 casino properties across six continents. The VizExplorer platform can be tailored to suit horizontal and other vertical applications and is also being used in beta by a professional sports team for marketing and venue-related analytics.  The Delivery Analyst is an advanced configuration analyst position. They are responsible for deployments and upgrades of VizExplorer software with a heavy influence on the progression of new technology and products.  DUTIES: Maintenance and updates of documents that form part of each solutionPrototyping functionality for existing and new productsEnsuring database performance is within defined standardsEnsuring data presented to clients is validated for accuracyWorking alongside other teams within the Professional Services group to resolve performance and quality issues as required.Escalation of solution and software issues to Team Leads and Product Management as needed.Taking a front line role in the deployment process, ensuring customers’ needs are met.Supporting both onsite and remote training as required.Other duties as assignedRequirementsBachelor Degree required in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.Foundation level knowledge of SQL requiredFoundation level knowledge of JavaScript preferredThe ability to learn new technologies and processes quicklyExcellent organizational skills and ability to meet deadlinesExceptional self-management abilitiesStrong communication and interpersonal skillsPrevious experience in a customer facing position preferredBenefits Competitive salary and benefits

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: US Tech Solutions is seeking a Financial Analyst for a 12+ Months Contract position with a client in San Diego, CA. Responsibilities: Provides general accounting and reporting support for a domestic manufacturing plants.  Analyzes and explains variances between forecasts, budget, and actual results.  Process multiple reporting packages for operating sites to report on inventory, spending, and volumes.  Communicates clearly with the finance and operations team on the plants performance.  Prepares weekly and month-end analyses  Works with cross functional teams to set budget and update forecasts for their business area monthly.  Demonstrates understanding of source documentation, research variances, and propose corrections.  Makes decisions, often difficult and/or unpopular, by carefully weighing pros and cons and acting in accordance with GAAP. Name: Analyst I, Compliance Strategies with American Specialty Hea
Description: The position listed below is not with San Diego Interviews but with American Specialty Health  San Diego Interviews is a private organization that works in collaboration with government agencies to promote emerging careers. Our goal is to connect you with supportive resources to supplement your skills in order to attain your dream career.  Analyst I, Compliance StrategiesAmerican Specialty Health, Inc. is seeking an Analyst to join our Regulatory Strategic Development department. The primary purpose of this position is to support the company's development of regulatory strategies to support business opportunities within the national regulatory framework and to support overall program compliance efforts. Note: The individual in this position is not intended to practice law or provide legal advice.You are invited to learn more about American Specialty Health's events on our events page.ResponsibilitiesMonitors proposed and existing regulations and laws, in partnership with Regulatory Compliance, to identify and support strategic regulatory development efforts. Develops and demonstrates understanding of business objectives, platforms and products to effectively identify emerging opportunities within the regulatory framework. Develops and demonstrates understanding of regulatory licensure and operational authority requirements to identify and support expansions of current licenses and operational authority to support business opportunities as directed by the VP. Consults with supervisor on an as needed basis to resolve any issues and to mitigate associated risks.Communicates and coordinates externally with regulatory authorities to understand regulatory requirements and enforcement expectations including, but not limited to, successfully negotiating with such authorities to achieve interpretations of regulatory requirements, consulting with supervisor on an ad-hoc basis regarding outcome of communication. Educates external contacts regarding unique aspects of ASH's business practices. Consults with supervisor on an as needed basis to resolve any issues and to mitigate associated risks.Communicates and coordinates internally with various departments to understand rationale of operations and business objectives and to communicate regulatory expectations of such operations including recommending courses of action, interpreting and translating enforcement expectations to proposed business practices. Also effectively communicates with internal departments to obtain necessary information for regulatory filings based on the needs of each regulatory agency, in part by educating internal contacts on the unique regulatory environments involved with strategic developments. Consults with supervisor on an as needed basis to resolve any issues and to mitigate associated risks.Acquires subject matter expertise on regulatory requirements in connection with identified business objectives for strategic regulatory developments in a constantly evolving regulatory environment.Researches, communicates and coordinates regulatory compliance issues across multiple disciplines and levels of workforce (i.e. communicates well with staff ranging from entry level to senior executive level personnel).Effectively manages assigned projects supporting strategic regulatory developments in a timely manners. Completes detailed legislative and regulatory reports for assigned project that includes assessments of impact to business operations, and licensing needs, consulting with supervisor on an ad-hoc basis to resolve any high level or complex issues. Effectively communicates such project progress to organization through written communication and oral presentations to designated committees and senior management.Performs detailed research, analysis and summarization of regulatory compliance issues. Recommends courses of actions regarding strategic regulatory development issues and presents recommendations to internal stakeholders. Consults with supervisor on an as needed basis to resolve complex issues.Supports and compiles documents for regulatory filings based on knowledge of unique regulatory framework while meeting required deadlines; such filings include, but are not limited to, the following: license applications and related inquiries.Supports department with regulatory compliance projects that impact regulatory strategies and related business objectives.Supports the Compliance Office by assisting with annual policy and/or procedure review processes.Supports and compiles documents for client reports based on knowledge of unique regulatory framework, while meeting required deadlines; such filings include but are not limited to the following: FDR reporting of training completion, exclusion checks and other Medicare contractual requirements; FDR questionnaires and self-assessments, and other reports based on delegated functions monitored by clients for compliance. Assumption of responsibility for state or federal compliance as directed by management either on a transitional basis or as needed.Assists with training of new employees and other staff as needed on a project basis at the direction of management.Immediately informs supervisor of urgent issues.Provides supervisor with timely periodic assignments status updates.Represents the company in an ethical, professional, and positive manner and complies with all company policies and procedures.Maintains confidentiality of all company information and uses discretion in discussing regulatory compliance issues with internal and external contacts.Maintains computer and system skills necessary to perform job functions.Photocopies, files, scans and faxes as needed to support job responsibilities.Strictly adheres to department administrative guidelines including, but not limited to, guidelines regarding project tracking and record keeping practices.Completes all ASH University training requirements, including required regulatory trainings, as well as ad hoc trainings required by management, within required timeframes.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Law, Health Care Administration or Policy, English, Political Science or equivalent field required; Master's degree in Health Care Administration, Legal degree or equivalent preferred.Minimum 2 years' regulatory compliance and/or legislative affairs experience, preferably in a health insurance environment. Name: Junior Payments Analyst
Description: Fintech  San Diego, CA At Housecall Pro, we are focused on helping home services professionals elevate their businesses and lives. Community coupled with the use of a modern and mobile software platform that handles the scheduling and management aspects frees our Pros to focus on their craft. Housecall Pros thrive and so do their businesses, which grow by 30% on average year over year. The home services industry remains vast ($700b+) but largely untouched by technology and unencumbered by a dominant competitor. The 3M+ businesses in home services space are facing dramatic change as the world shifts from offline to online. Along this journey, we are quickly becoming the backbone operating system for service labor across the US and Canada. We have rocketed from MVP to the #1 ranked SaaS software platform very quickly...which has made us the fastest growing startup in San Diego.Responsibilities: Review, identify, and investigate potentially fraudulent transactions Evaluate new accounts and determine their eligibility to utilize our payment processing Handle the management and documentation of fraudulent cases from start to end Own case communications with Pros via email and our chat system Work effectively across the org by communicating fraud trends Be current with credit card fraud trends Work with engineering to calibrate internal fraud processes and algorithms Evaluate and improve internal processes towards automation and efficiencyMinimum qualifications:education level, years of experience in a certain field, experience with certain technical aspects, who they are- customer empathy, data driven, etc. Strong and effective communication skills; both verbally and written Strong decision making skills Ability to learn quickly and on the fly A problem solver, you search for the whysPreferred qualifications:not necessary but nice to have and may put them ahead of other candidates (i.e. masters degree, additional experience, worked with certain clients, etc.) Bachelors in Accounting, Economics, or similar Experience with fraud detection and prevention Cursory understanding of predictive algorithms Experience with Salesforce Experience with StripeWhy Housecall Pro Housecall Pro is a mission-driven company. Our co-founder/CEO built a software company to help service professionals like his father (a house painter), get to a better life. We save our service professional time, and help them, in turn, to delight their end-customers. We are tackling the last, large market ($700b+) untouched by technology and unencumbered by a dominant competitor. Our goal is to build a $10 billion+ company that is a powerful brand to home service providers and consumers. We have fun at work. Really. Competitive compensation and benefits. Equity in a growth stage startup backed by top-tier VCs. San Diego is an idyllic place to live; our office is minutes away from hiking/biking trails, and the surf. Paid holidays and self-managed (unlimited) paid time off. Housecall Pro is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Housecall Pro is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Name: Ops Initiatives Coordinator - Analyst
Description: Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world with total assets of over $2.4 trillion (as ranked by SNL Financial, April 2016) and 140,000 colleagues in nearly 50 countries. In the U.S., we're 13,000 strong, working together to positively impact every customer, organization, and community we serve. We achieve this by delivering on our values, putting people first, fostering long-term relationships built on honesty and mutual understanding, and inspiring the best in each other. This is all part of our inclusive, high-performing culture supported by Total Rewards that include our cash balance pension plan. Join a team that's working to fulfill its vision to be the world's most trusted financial group. Job Summary:Reporting to a senior level manager, the Operations Initiatives Coordinator is responsible for managing the Work Order Queue at the division level and attending all IT Queue meetings. The coordinator facilitates the assignment of the queue priorities for the division's work orders and validates significance of work orders. Ensures all Work Orders are properly documented and tracked as well as delivered on time and within budget. Acting as a liaison for the designated OCSG division, the incumbent applies a specific knowledge of the business combined with knowledge of the systems technology capabilities to business problem solving. Manages straight forward, non-complex work requests to include: process improvements, service or efficiency initiatives, product or system modifications, merger related activities, and other requests as assigned. Major Responsibilities:Tracks and monitors work order requests, performing regular status updates.Identify and report obstacles or variances that cannot be resolved that would impede the delivery of the project on time and within budget.Liaisons with various areas and resources outside the division/dept; i.e., ITG, for ensuring deadlines are met and conflicts are resolved.Prepare and deliver presentations, participate in meeting with users to define and evaluate business problems.Create and distribute reports; develop and implement statistical spreadsheets.Assists Project Manager(s) in ensuring projects are running smoothly and on time.Monitors project plans for task completion and diplomatically works with team members to keep projects on schedule.Delivers assigned initiatives on time, on budget, and within scope.Utilizes operational and business line knowledge for partnering with business unit managers to understand business needs and provide subject mater expertise on assigned duties.Articulates the line of business needs/requirements including identified solutions within the organization to obtain project buy-in.Identifies appropriate resources to assess risks, controls, and regulatory compliance issues and ensures a documented risk assessment review.Reviews business requirements and obtains appropriate approvals.Coordinates UAT testing and ensures problem resolution of any issues.Conducts and facilitates meetings to resolve business problems and oversee implementation of assigned changes made within the business.Additional Information:Prefer Bachelors Degree in business, or other equivalent experience.Minimum 1 year leading and implementing change initiatives preferably within a financial services environment, or equivalent work experience.Capable of handling business line initiatives with minimal support.Has demonstrated priority setting, problem solving, negotiating, and conflict management skills.Functional, technical, and operational organization skills required, including the ability to develop strong alliances at all levels within the organization.Sound oral, interpersonal, and written communication skills.Sound decision making skills that demonstrate originality, flexibility, and resourcefulness.Action oriented; Ability to adapt to change and implement quickly based on overall direction and needs of the company.High quantity producer and ability to manager multiple priorities and commitments concurrently.Demonstrated computer skills utilizing applicable PC applications to include Microsoft, Web, and bank related applications.Stay abreast with industry trends.The highest level of integrity, customer focus, and partnership is a minimum standard requirement.Must be a self starter and have the ability to work independently.Ability to coordinate and direct activities of others. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities duties and skills required of personnel so classified.  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category.  A conviction is not an absolute bar to employment. Factors such as the age of the offense, evidence of rehabilitation, seriousness of violation, and job relatedness are considered in all employment decisions. Additionally, it's the bank's policy to only inquire into a candidate's criminal history after an offer has been made. Federal law prohibits banks from employing individuals who have been convicted of, or received a pretrial diversion for, certain offenses.

Name: Business Systems Analyst with Plaza Home Mortgage
Description: The position listed below is not with San Diego Interviews but with Plaza Home Mortgage  San Diego Interviews is a private organization that works in collaboration with government agencies to promote emerging careers. Our goal is to connect you with supportive resources to supplement your skills in order to attain your dream career.  Plaza Home Mortgage, Inc., a national wholesale mortgage company headquartered in San Diego, California, has a full-time opportunity for a Business Systems Analyst with our San Diego, California Corporate Office.  Plaza Home Mortgage, Inc. was originally founded in December of 2000 to serve the San Diego area mortgage market. Due to our growth and success, we now have branches throughout the United States and we are continuing to grow and expand in anticipation of market demands. Plaza is privately owned and operates as a full-service Mortgage Banker.  Plaza s mission is to become the premier provider of mortgage loans by developing a distinct, sustainable competitive advantage through superior execution of a business philosophy that combines knowledge, technology, and service. Plaza Home Mortgage, Inc. is dedicated to building long-term relationships with both customers and employees through quality training, and excellent customer support.  Our ideal candidate should be hardworking and maintain high levels of professionalism and ethics. PRIMARY PURPOSE OF JOB AND CONTRIBUTION TO ORGANIZATION: This position is responsible for providing analysis and QA support to the Business Intelligence team. The selected candidate will be an analytical, data-savvy, highly motivated critical thinker. They will be responsible for working collaboratively with end-users, subject matter experts, IT analysts and technical staff to understand, analyze, and communicate complex reporting needs, and to ensure all aspects of current and future BI solutions enhance organizational decision making. ESSENTIAL TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Must comply with all BSA/AML requirements as well as any mandatory changes. The following job functions are not all-inclusive. The associate will be required to perform other job-related tasks/responsibilities requested by the manager. Job duties may change as required by needs of company. Must complete all required industry and compliance training as required by Plaza Home Mortgage.  Provides analysis for the development of business intelligence solutions.  Analyzes business needs and creates functional requirements based on interactions with subject matter experts, BI developers and database team.  Analyzes the capabilities of existing reports and dashboards ensuring functionality and customization where necessary.  Manages report request queue  Participates in the planning, designing, and execution of user testing efforts and migration to Production.  Designs and delivers end-user training and training materials,  Strong understanding of testing methodologies and practice  Experience with writing test plans, test cases, and scripts based on business requirements  Experience in database query manipulation , writing SQL statements and stored procedures using Microsoft SQL  Job Requirements QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor s degree (B.A. or B.S.) required, Information Systems or Business. Advanced degree a plus.  3-5 years related experience required  SQL & Crystal reporting  Experience working with stakeholders and end-users to define, test, elicit and deliver functional BI requirements  Strong analytical skills including ability to think critically  Knowledge of reporting tools  Experience using Microsoft SQL  Analytical and communication skills  Expertise with MS Excel  Must be flexible and work analytically in a problem-solving, results-oriented environment  Must be able to clearly communicate stakeholder reporting needs  Must be willing to work with and learn new technologies  Must be action oriented with excellent follow through  Strong attention to detail with ability to manage multiple priorities and possess exceptional organizational skills.  Proven aptitude to work collaboratively with multiple team members.CORE COMPETENCIES:  Analytical Thinking  Attention to Detail  Information Gathering and Processing  Problem Solving  Results Management  Interactive Communication  Using IT  Teamwork  Strategic Thinking  Work Ethic and ValuesPlaza offers a great work environment. Plaza is an EEOC employer and follows all federal, state, and local laws relating to fair employment.  Plaza Home Mortgage, Inc. is committed to preventing, stopping and remedying all forms of discrimination that occur in its workplace. Managers are accountable for keeping Plaza s workplace free from discrimination and ensuring that Plaza provides equal employment opportunity for all in the workforce and for those seeking to become members of Plaza s workforce. These protections extend to all management practices and decisions, including recruitment and hiring practices, appraisal systems, promotions, and training and career development programs. Name: JE-OPETS Program Analyst III
Description: Established in 2001, The Tauri Group is a professional services firm known for our analytic rigor, practical solutions, and trusted advice in the areas of CBRN threat mitigation, defense science and technology, homeland security, and adjacent domains. We offer the financial stability and breadth of capability of a large company coupled with the corporate commitment and attention of a small firm. Our subject matter expertise, determination, agility, and commitment to active and ongoing client and stakeholder engagement enable us to solve tough problems and deliver results-oriented solutions that help our customers achieve mission success. We tackle our clients most challenging problems by combining analytical rigor with world-class expertise and relevant operational experience. At The Tauri Group, we do what s right for the Program, the Mission, and the Nation.  The Joint Program Executive Office for Chemical and Biological Defense (JPEO-CBD) is the US Department of Defense (DoD) point for research, development, acquisition, fielding and life-cycle support of biological, chemical and nuclear defense equipment and medical countermeasures to the Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, and Special Operations Command. We are seeking Program Analysts to support the JPEO CBD and selected Joint Project Managers under the upcoming JE-OPETS contract. Candidates for positions in VA (Ft Belvoir, Stafford, King George), MD (Edgewood, Ft Detrick) and San Diego, CA are needed and will support the JPEO CBD Headquarters and Joint Product Mangers for Information Systems, Protection, Guardian, and Medical Systems. Ideal candidates will have experience analyzing and evaluating program development and be able to provide consultation to Product Managers. You will be developing written plans, policies, and procedures to document processes and be responsible for monthly reporting, briefings and tracking projects. Candidates must have a current SECRET clearance.Education and Experience Required Bachelors degree with 8 years general experience and 5 years relevant experience  Experience with facilitating milestone planning by preparing, reviewing, and updating technical briefing materials and documentation  Experience working within the DoD acquisition system developing key acquisition documentation such as Life Cycle Cost Estimate, the Life Cycle Management Plan, Test and Evaluation Master Plan, Systems Engineering Plan, Budget Spend Plans; DAWIA Certification is desirable  Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs; Requires proficiency with Primavera and MS Project  Experience in researching, analyzing, and evaluating information  Be a certified Master Exercise Practitioner (MEP) and have extensive knowledge in training and exercise standards as well as have a conversant knowledge in the support of CONOPS plans development in the Emergency Management arena (Guardian)  Possess extensive knowledge of Department of Army Training Development Capability (TDC), certified Homeland Security Exercise Evaluation Program (HSEEP) knowledge, and instructor certified in CBRNE and Emergency Management operations (Guardian)  Have knowledge of TRADOC policy and regulations (Guardian) ResponsibilitiesAssist in maintaining program management tools and processes and assist in the development of program documentation including but not limited to the Acquisition Program Baseline, Life Cycle Management Plan (LCMP), Acquisition Status Reports, etc, and briefing materials and shall track the status of action items, meeting minutes, program milestones and monthly reports.Manage Integrated Product Team (IPT) or participate and provide input to program functional IPT, In-Process Reviews, Milestone Decisions, and required program updates.Author executive summaries and technical articles regarding JPEO CBD programs for publication.Apply managerial and executive skills to construct and maintain a program IMS, review, analyze and evaluate program development, progress and performance, and provide on-going analytical, acquisition and administrative support by managing and coordinating daily staff operations.Provide program information for developing policy, cost projections, programmatic input into program documentation including, but not limited to, the Life Cycle Cost Estimate, the Life Cycle Management Plan, Test and Evaluation Master Plan, Systems Engineering Plan, Budget Spend Plans etc…Manages a risk loaded IMS for a complete engineering development program involving hardware and software development, multiple sub-component integration, and system testing.Applies risk probabilities and expected impacts and opportunity probabilities and expected benefits to program schedules using Monte Carlo simulation to determine likely start and completion dates of critical activities and milestones within a range of statistical confidence.Maintain program integrated master schedule that synchronizes activities of all program management functional areas into logically linked sequence of events from program initiation to program completion such that activity changes in any one functional area reveals affects on activities of all other functional areas and reflective of risk at the define confidence level.Provide expert consultation to the product managers on their acquisition strategy to ensure consistency with the DoDD 5000 and JPEO Acquisition policies.Be responsible for archiving legacy program information and creating indices for easy retrieval of archived information and execute a process for migrating existing shared data to the SharePoint site.Implement current and emerging Homeland Security Presidential Directives, Presidential Preparedness Directives (PPD) and Department of Defense Directives (DODD).Serve as system domain administrator for Army TDC system. At The Tauri Group, you'll collaborate with an elite, creative team of scientists, engineers, analysts, operations specialists, policy experts, and acquisition support specialists. We attract people who love their work and are dedicated to the complex challenges facing today's world. Our culture fosters engagement and enthusiasm, attracts and retains proven experts, and maintains a flexible environment that supports clients and staff. From our easily accessible offices in Alexandria, Virginia to our comprehensive benefits package, every aspect of our operations is designed to bring us the best in the field.  Financially, The Tauri Group is a smart choice, offering: Highly competitive salaries401(k), including competitive matching and 100 % vesting after only one yearBusiness development and referral bonuses We support your life outside of the office, too, with benefits including: Highly competitive medical insurance and multiple plans to choose fromDental and vision insurance plansTuition assistanceProfessional development opportunitiesEight paid hours a year that you can devote to charityFlexible work schedules

Name: Project Analyst, Senior
Description: Job Number: R0033382 Project Analyst, SeniorKey Role:  Manage the delivery of multiple project initiatives designed to enhance the services and level of support provided to the client. Maintain responsibility for the planning, organization, directing, controlling, and delivery of all projects prioritized in alignment with the clients expectations and business needs. Ensure the ongoing process and system capability associated with projects and manage any changes required to meet or exceed the expectations established in project designs. Direct activities of consultants, analysts, specialists, and sub-contractors, maintain responsibility to ensure appropriate resources are allocated, and facilitate the successful completion of multiple projects. Serve as an expert on complex technical and business matters. Determine work priorities based on general direction from managers. Name: Financial Analyst III
Description: Job DetailsLevel ExperiencedJob Location HORIZON CENTER - San Diego, CAPosition Type ExemptEducation Level 4 Year DegreeSalary Range UndisclosedTravel Percentage NoneJob Shift UndisclosedJob Category FinanceDescriptionSUMMARY: Sets up and maintains the Asset/Liability Management (ALM) system including projections, net economic value (NEV), interest rate risk (IRR), and what-if scenarios. Provides data analytics for the credit union by proactively gathering information from various sources. Works with vast amounts of data to uncover hidden information to assist in making smarter business decisions. Uses data mining and statistical analysis techniques to maximize results. Assists with other financial systems including organizational and product profitability. Performs financial analysis including statistical reports, performance measurement, and trend analysis. Prepares monthly financial reports for Board of Directors, Asset and Liability Management Committee, Sr. Management, Department and Branch managers. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Sets up, operates and maintains the ALM system, including monthly updates, projections and reporting. Performs ALM tasks including IRR, NEV and what-if scenarios. Maintains account specifics including key rate ties, prepay/decay rates, re-pricing, etc. Ensures the control, accuracy and integrity of the ALM system.  2. Provides VP, Finance & Treasury Manager with research on various investment strategies and portfolio analysis and presents findings to Investment Committee. Provides regular reporting and analysis for derivatives program.  3. Prepares BOD and ALCO packages including various financial and statistical reports, and assimilate economic and industry information.  4. Models different asset structures to accurately capture cash flows and calculate ROIs.  5. Models liquidity for purposes of cash flow analysis and stress liquidity.  6.Prepares and analyzes peer data analysis and other data as required. Continuously improves the efficiency and effectiveness of financial analysis and reporting. Provides procedures and documentation of processes.Performs ad hoc analysis as requested and participates on committees as needed.QualificationsEducation: Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting or a related field is required. Two years of equivalent experience can substitute for every one year of education. Experience: A minimum of 5 years Finance/Accounting experience to include preparation of financial statements, financial management experience to include ALM, calculation of financial ratios and financial decision making techniques, and experience in designing and generating reports using Excel and PowerPoint software is required. Strong understanding of economic and accounting principles is required.  Ability to read, analyze and interpret financial statements, business periodicals, technical procedures and government regulations is required. Investment portfolio and derivatives analysis and reporting experience desired. COMPETENCIES:Skills: Requires strong analytical and organizational skills, as well as strong written and verbal communication skills. Software: Microsoft Office Suite, Internet, financial institution Asset & Liability Management systems, Profitability systems, Business Intelligence/CRM applications, and Symitar or related core processor systems. PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORKING CONDITIONS:Constant sitting, bending (neck), twisting (neck), repetitive hand use involving simple grasping and fine manipulation.Frequent bending (waist) and twisting (waist).Occasional walking, standing, squatting, kneeling, hand use involving power grasping, pushing & pulling, reaching (above & below shoulder), lifting & carrying 0-25 lbs.**Critical features of this job are described under the headings above. They may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.**

Name: Pharmacy Network Reporting Analyst
Description: Pharmacy Network Reporting Analyst If you’re interested in a career within a customer-focused, team-oriented environment that rewards innovation, quality, integrity and collaboration, MedImpact Healthcare Systems, Inc. welcomes your application. MedImpact, is a privately-held pharmacy benefit manager (PBM) headquartered in San Diego, California. Our solutions and services positively influence healthcare outcomes and expenditures, improving the position of our clients in the market. MedImpact offers high-value solutions to payers, providers and consumers of healthcare in the U.S. and foreign markets. Position Summary The Pharmacy Network Reporting Analyst provides detailed, timely and accurate pharmacy network and prescription claims data analysis and pricing information to assist departments in business-decision making, risk management, compliance and to obtain and maintain clients. Ensures activities are aligned with corporate strategies and focused on the company’s bottom-line performance. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Performs ad-hoc analyses as requested and needed by business owners, or in support of identified business objectives, with special focus on pharmacy network set-up and performanceSupports Medicare Part D network access compliance by utilizing “GeoAccess” software to accurately measure and report access for either individual or national clients. Shares and explains network access analysis and results to clients and internal staffProactively identifies opportunities to use analysis and reporting tools to: (1) achieve company business objectives, (2) supports business information needs to promote improved decision-making and, (3) enhance staff efficiencyEnsures that analyses are complete and accurate to defined specifications.Provides support to pharmacy network and strategy managementInterprets and analyzes data outputs to explain possible anomalies that exist with in the data to management and external clientsSupports Medicare Part D audits by providing necessary network reporting and demonstrating ongoing compliance with Medicare Part D network and access standardsEffectively uses the current adjudication software platform (MedAccess) to QC work and investigate non-optimal outcomesSupports the Request for Proposal (RFP) process by providing network analyses that are accurate and responsive to RFP questions.Organizes work to provide complete and accurate analyses in order to meet RFP deadlinesEducation and/or Experience For consideration, candidates will need a Bachelor's degree (or equivalent combination of education and experience) along with a required two (2) plus years’ job related experience. Experience analyzing medical and/or pharmacy claims including prior PBM experience is highly desired. Computer Skills Working knowledge of programming query skills (SQL or other); familiarity with relational databases desired; proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office Suite is required. Other Skills and AbilitiesManages multiple priorities with minimal supervisionBasic understanding of concept of financial riskHigh level technical skills and thorough understanding of business analysisFamiliarity with relational databasesBroad knowledge of financial, statistical and health analytic principles required This position is eligible for Employee Referral Bonus at Level I EOE, M/F/D/VOSHA/ADA: To perform this job successfully, the successful candidate must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.

Name: Financial Analyst - FP&A
Description: Financial Analyst II  22-Oct-2018 Company General Atomics Aeronautical Systems Job Summary General Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc. (GA-ASI), an affiliate of General Atomics, is a world leader in proven, reliable remotely piloted aircraft and tactical reconnaissance radars, as well as advanced high-resolution surveillance systems.  We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.  We have an exciting opportunity for a Financial Analyst to join the Financial Planning and Analysis division of our Financial Services group at General Atomics Aeronautical Systems located in Rancho Bernardo, Ca. This position, under general supervision is responsible for supporting profit center revenue, cost of sales, gross margin, discretionary spending through profit (loss) relative to direct projects on a Monthly/Quarterly basis, the forecasts will involve one or more calendar year. This person must be able to work in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment, with the capacity to provide ad hoc reporting and analysis. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Provide variance analysis activities throughout the year, that will drive ad hoc analytics to support the business as well as similar efforts when requested, routinely provide operational financial performance trends, historical & forecasted using appropriate metrics.Support timely, relevant and accurate reporting & analysis of the results of the division’s performance against historical, budgeted, forecasted and strategic planning results to facilitate decision-making toward the achievement of the budget and strategic plan.Maintain various financial models and standard templates distributed for use by all of Finance during the planning processes, ensuring quality, accuracy and focused analytic review.Provide support to Program Area business units by being the first point of contact for issues and questions.Demonstrate appropriate understanding / working knowledge of accounting principles and internal controls, and apply them.Support collaborative development of modeling tools, review of existing financial processes and development of new and/or improved planning processes, identify financial issues, recommend solutions and provide corrective action to any financial discrepancies.Provide support for executive level presentations.Assist in data maintenance & data validation of the newly implemented Planning Tool in support of the Financial Planning and Analysis team.Perform other duties as assigned or required.Job ID#21270BRJob Category Finance/Accounting Travel Percentage Required0% - 25%Full-Time/Part-Time Full-Time Salary State California City San Diego Clearance Required? No Title Financial Analyst - FP&A Job QualificationsTypically requires a bachelor's degree in business administration with an emphasis in finance and/or accounting and three or more years of progressive professional experience in financial analysis in a corporate environment, preferably with a government contractor. May substitute equivalent experience in lieu of education.Must have a general understanding of industry and government cost accounting principles, theories and concepts.Must be customer focused and possess: (1) the ability to develop solutions to a variety of problems of moderate scope and complexity; (2) excellent verbal and written communications and presentations skills to accurately document and report accounting and finance findings to a variety of audiences; (3) excellent interpersonal skills to influence and guide employees, managers and external parties on accounting and finance matters; (4) the ability to maintain the confidentiality of sensitive information; and, (5) excellent computer skills.Business Planning and Consolidation (BPC) experience highly desirable.Ability to work independently or in a team environment is essential as is the ability to work extended hours and travel as required.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionRAL Investment Corporation is a multi-faceted Company located in San Diego, CA. As a growing corporation, we are looking for energetic, motivated, and confident Financial Analysts to undertake critical financial analysis roles, reporting directly to the CFO. These roles are specific and within the major divisions of RAL Investment Corporation; these being Silverstrand Construction and Shore Total Office, with contracts in Construction and Furniture for federal, state, and commercial clients, respectively.  Financial Analysts for the Company shall have the ability to report and hold project team members accountable for the financial success of projects; the core function is to create, enforce, uphold and report on the financial viability of projects. Additionally functions will be conducting investigative and exploratory financial projects working directly with the CFO to affect the profitability of the Company. We Offer:Outstanding Total Compensation Package (Generous Salary based on your industry leadership experience, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, & Life Insurance)!Engaging company CultureImpactful team environmentChallenging and complex accounting projectsCreative and innovative problem solving environmentSupportive, communicative managers who reward your successOpportunities for training, development, and growthKey Responsibilities:Tracking and reconciling job costsWorking with respective teams to create initial project budgetsVerifying budgets against estimatesConsistently tracking project profitability, and reporting at milestones and as requiredTracking productivity (labor and otherwise)Providing productivity analysis matrices for stakeholder useConducting profit analysis and ROI exercises for project and non-project specific itemsWorking with internal leadership team/stakeholders as part of the reporting process.Developing thoughtful analysis and delivering key insights that support strategic decision making.Recommending ways to automate reporting and streamline processes.​ ​Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree required with a preference in finance or related field. The environment is collaborative and engaging, transparent and challenging. Said environment is geared for critical thinkers, aspiring leaders, motivated persons, and individuals looking for a unique challenge for personal and professional success. The Corporation is focused on growth through engaging with a passionate team to create passionate projects.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Our vision at Petco is Healthier Pets. Happier People. Better World. We’re making things better for pets, people and the planet through our Think Adoption First philosophy, the Petco Foundation and other important initiatives that focus on putting animals first, educating pet parents and reducing our carbon footprint. The journey starts with knowledgeable, passionately engaged associates who are proud to recommend Petco as a place to work, who believe in our Vision and who are committed to delivering a superior customer experience. From our retail stores and our network of Distribution Centers to our Corporate offices, you'll work with others who share your values and commitment. We seek individuals who are passionate about animal welfare, have great people skills and are driven to grow and advance in their careers with us. Our ongoing growth is creating exceptional opportunities for professional development and personal enrichment throughout our organization. Position Purpose:The Financial Analyst will be for our San Diego, CA location. The successful candidate will report to the Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis, and support the Manager of Planning & IT. Will perform analyses and various financial reports that focus on assisting management in preparing budgets, understanding company/store/distribution center performance, supporting financial systems. Perform ad-hoc financial analysis. Provide forecasting and reporting support for capital finance, and review and identify key drivers for variances. Essential Job Functions: The incumbent must be able to perform all of the following duties and responsibilities with or without a reasonable accommodation.Interact professionally and effectively through verbal and written communication with all professional contacts with emphasis on company interests.Manage creation of complex management reports. Analyze financial data to determine appropriate recommendation for action.Work with full P&L statements, budgeting, and 5 year planning.Implement and develop new process improvements.Work with balance sheet analytics.Present analytical data to interpret to non-technical audience.Utilizing Essbase, PeopleSoft Financial, and Blackline Accounts Reconciliation System (ARMS).Analyze capital impact on cash flow and balance sheet; reviewing monthly forecast changes and impacts for both capital cash purchases and capital with accruals.Provide capital support to tax teamOccasional peak time work required through month-end close forecasting and budget.Supervisory Responsibility:NoneWork Environment:The majority of job duties are conducted while seated indoors at a computer terminal, with little or no exposure to hazards. Occasional travel may be required for financial presentations or training.Education/Experience:Bachelor’s Degree in Business in Finance or Accounting required; MBA in Finance, CPA or CMA a plus.3 or more years related experience in financial analysis plus experience within retail operations and/or capital financial analysis; experience with balance sheet, cash flow, working capital, and capital spending analysis.Strong financial analytical skills, and intermediate level MS Excel skills. Understanding of financial statements and what drives profitability.Strong technical skills and hands-on experience working with financial and database software. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Excellent presentation and communication skills due to the nature and level of interaction with senior management and other departments.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Small, family-run investment firm is looking for a rockstar investment analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate for this position is someone with off-the-charts analytical skills and a passion for business, management, and investing.  Job duties are as follows: Work with the managing partner to identify, source, and make investments in small businesses or other asset classesResearch industries and trends as necessary to justify investmentsAnalyze financials, contracts, and statistics to evaluate opportunitiesFollow and monitor portfolio companies' progress once investments have been made; make suggestions on how to improve cash flows and reduce costsAttend board meetings with managing partner as needed to report resultsJob RequirementsBachelors degree in accounting, mathematics, business, management, or data scienceA proven interest in, and passion for investingStrong mathematics and analytical skillsA desire to work on a small team, own your work, and make decisions that matter**Required Cover Letter Please include a cover letter with your application that contains an answer to the following question:  If you were handed $1,000,000 today and asked to produce as much risk-adjusted return as possible over the next 5 years, how would you invest it, and why?  *Be as specific as possible, and provide a thoughtful answer that justifies your choice with a logical argument Applicants that dont provide an answer to this question wont be considered  Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $60,000.00 to $65,000.00 /year  Education:Bachelor's (Required)

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Ethertronics is seeking an Financial Analyst. This position will streamline and prepare operational budget and forecasting models. Name: Technical Resource Center Analyst
Description: The CompanyHitachi Vantara combines technology, intellectual property and industry knowledge to deliver data-managing solutions that help enterprises improve their customers’ experiences, develop new revenue streams, and lower the costs of business. Hitachi Vantara elevates your innovation advantage by combining IT, operational technology (OT) and domain expertise. Come join our team and our employee-focused culture and help drive our customers’ data to meaningful customer outcomes. The RoleThe Technical Resource Center Analyst is a critical member of a small and highly skilled global team working closely with Hitachi Vantara and partner engineering. Candidate will provide centralized technical support to help internal and external customers implement and maintain successful solutions leveraging Hitachi Vantara Unified Converged Platform Solutions, including Hitachi Vantara Compute, Data Networks, and Storage and Management software.This position is a customer facing Solutions escalation support role. Candidate will provide timely and professional technical support to Hitachi Vantara customers and partners in an enterprise support environment. A successful candidate will possess a working knowledge of operating systems, compute, networking, public/private/hybrid cloud, and storage technologies.The candidate will potentially be involved in a variety of technical issues pertaining to Enterprise Class Hardware (Compute and Storage), Networking (SAN, LAN, WAN), Hardware Management and Monitoring tools, Databases (MS SQL, postgres, etc.), Applications, and Operating Systems/Hypervisors (VMware, SUSE, RedHat, Microsoft/Hyper-V).ResponsibilitiesThis Level 2 support specialist is a recognized solutions expert and technical lead during service request/customer case interactions. Primary areas of expertise shall include operating system, networking, compute and storage as it pertains to converged infrastructure and their use in Public, Private and Hybrid could applications.Develop and provide accurate and creative solutions for customer issues resulting in a timely distribution of knowledge and positive impact on customer satisfaction.Create and present to customers documentation on technical problems, troubleshooting steps, recommendations and action plans.Contribute to Technical Knowledge Base by creating tech tips, product alerts, and other content for the Hitachi Vantara Customer Portal.Develop and provide technical coaching and mentoring to other support center specialists.Participate in team projects that enhance the effectiveness of the global support center.Act as a product liaison for major products, working with other corporate departments and 3rd party developers to solve technical issues.Communicate with management team on “critical” issues requiring immediate attention.Stay current on emerging converged architecture and cloud technologies, internal development roadmaps and other industry issues that impact Hitachi Vantara solution positioning and troubleshooting.Attend ongoing training to keep technical skills up to date, particularly with respect to VMware, MSFT, Linux/Unix, Brocade FC/IP, Cisco FC/IP, Compute, Storage, and with converged solution and application solutions.Able to perform shift work to include nights, weekends, and on-call standby. Shift rotations adjust based on primary need for the Hitachi Vantara customer base at any given point in time.QualificationsDegree or equivalent formal education and/or working experienceCertifications like VCP, CCNA, LPI or RHCE is highly preferred.A minimum of 5 years experience with a post-sales support of enterprise class solutions including servers, network, SAN, storage and virtualization technologies including installation, diagnostics, performance, and troubleshootingA good knowledge of Public/Private/Hybrid cloud technologiesThe candidate will have an aptitude for providing positive customer service and good communication, problem solving, and technical writing skillsPossess the ability to resolve issues and conflicts, as well as be able to take ownership when faced with challenging situationsAbility to relate and communicate effectively with client technologists and management when requiredEthical and honest in all respectsWillingness to travel to customer sites, other Hitachi Vantara offices, or training facilities when requiredWillingness to perform shift work to include nights, weekends, and on-call standby. Shift rotations adjust based on primary need for the Hitachi Vantara customer base at any given point in timeJob is located in Hitachi Vantara San Diego support facility#LI-DNIHitachi Vantara is an equal opportunity employer. Name: Senior Financial Analyst, FP&A
Description: Let's Make games Better Together! Here at Daybreak, we make games that bring people together: to build them and to play them. Together we have built and introduced some of the most famed and beloved gaming franchises to millions of players worldwide including H1Z1®, DC Universe Online, PlanetSide®, and EverQuest®.  We are obsessed with the entire creation process and passion for play is what makes us one with our players. From group raiding epics in Norrath to watching our favorite streamers ravage zombies in the post-apocalypse, we are devoted to delivering the ultimate gaming experience to our communities. Let's make games better together. Are you up for the challenge? Here's some specifics on what we're looking for...  The Senior Financial Analyst will report to the Senior Director of FP&A and manage the day-to-day aspects of financial planning an analysis to help key stakeholders understand drivers of revenue, cost and profitability in order to make more strategic businesses decisions. Essential Duties include but are not limited to:Month-End reporting for project based P&Ls and Department expensesPrepare Budget vs Actual Analysis discuss with department and project leadsAssist in building forecasting models to help manage financial risk and opportunitiesReorganization of expense categories to increase visibility and understanding into department expendituresProduce monthly variance analysis containing concise and meaningful results and commentaryVisualize and present key data in a clear, user-friendly mannerAnswer business and financial performance related questionsReview and approve expensesHelp prepare financial planning presentations to key stakeholders (Executives, board members, etc.)Various ad hoc projectsAssist with annual financial audit Competencies, Skills and Knowledge5+ years' FP&A or related experienceStrong knowledge of financial reporting systems and/or financial planning systemsHigh attention to detail with ability to keep overall strategy in mindOutgoing and positive to ask questions to understand the businessAbility to work independently with little supervisionStrong written and verbal communication skillsEnjoys taking on challenging projects and looking for ways to improve processesExcellent organizational skillsMotivated and takes pride in workAbility to adapt to readily to the changing needs of the businessStrong work ethic and ability to maintain high level confidentialityAdvanced knowledge of Excel (Ex: Pivot Tables, Macros, Graphs)Adaptive Insights experience preferred but not requiredProficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)Supervisory experience a plusBachelor's Degree in Business, Economics, Finance or Accounting

Name: Configuration Management Analyst
Description: SUMMARY  Responsible for maintaining data integrity of MRP system and coordinating all MRP system updates with the appropriate departments such as Operations, Finance and Information Services (IS). Is the primary knowledge base for the day to day activities in Prometheus MRP system.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Evaluates and processes all DCRs; coordinate all data input into the MRP system.Serves as liaison between Operations and Finance on all product/part configuration matters.Corrects the MRP system as needed based on the audit process.Establishes new master records and maintains existing item master records.Maintains and tracks the data integrity of the MRP data entry system.Establishes procedures for internal customers related to MRP system use.Works with functional owners to identify, troubleshoot and resolve issues in routine operations for the CLIA lab, Information Services, Manufacturing, Materials Management, Quality Control and Quality System.Maintains a thorough understanding of the end-to-end process and the MRP system configuration that drives the processCreates and maintains documentation for tools used to support configuration management and MRP system.Creates documentation on the MRP system configuration including the definition of security roles.Creates SOPs pertaining to process in the MRP system.Create BOMs, routings, part numbersImplements and coordinates MRP process change and item updates with stakeholders.Audits for missing operating data in support of material, capacity planning and procurement.Ensures that users of the MRP system are trained in the correct usage of the system and coordinates with hiring managers for new employee GP training.Identifies ways to improve operational efficiencies in the MRP process, including system changesCoordinates tasks between Information Services (IS) group and the MRP system vendor to implement system changes, updates and repairs assuring the task are completed.Responsible for running some system utilities during non-business hoursLeads MRP process improvement projectsEnsures compliance with applicable regulations & policies.Abides by company rules, policies, and proceduresFollows safety policies and proceduresWorks on special projects as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE  Position generally requires a BS and 5+ years related experience. Experience with SAP, Oracle or MS Dynamics Great Plains required.

Name: PACE Application Analyst
Description: Position Summary: The PACE Applications Analyst is an intermediate analyst position responsible for troubleshooting and coordinating the resolution of problems occurring with all business and clinical applications. He/she will work independently in managing application related service tickets, documenting findings and communicating status with the end-users. The Applications Analyst will support problem resolution, enhancement requests, and project tasks by building system components, testing, documenting workflows and related information, implementation support and maintenance of TruChart EMR along with other business and clinical applications as needed. He/she will create and evaluate processes, procedures, and workflows and will serve as the subject matter expert to users and other IT team members on the functionality of the organization's mission critical applications. The Applications Analyst will follow the software development lifecycle to manage development, testing, and deployment of changes. He/she will follow internal governance processes at all times He/she will be proactive in the investigation and application of best practices and have a good understanding of regulatory requirements related PACE. Essential Functions of the Job:Ensures compliance with PACE regulations, assists to develop policies and procedures and assists with preparation for PACE audits for all TrueChart users.Works closely with Quality Management to ensure TruChart user data meets quality and corporate compliance.Participates in Project planning and meetings and works with PACE team as required.Prepares and submits monthly reports to the VP of Senior Health Services.Reviews changes and upcoming developments in software applications.Creates documentation for supported systems and enhancements.Ensures new employees are entered in TruChart and inactivate terminated employees. Provides new employee orientation and ongoing education.Provide education to super users and coordinate end user education for patches, update, and upgrades including both impacts to functionality, clinical workflow, and business processes.Technical troubleshooting for hardware issues collaborating with local ITS Desktop.Oversees monitoring of error and efax failures as applicable to lab and pharmacy messaging.Participate with testing TruChart updates. Coordinate testing of patches, updates and upgrades as well as reviewing / updating associated workflow and business processes.Participate with distribution of TruChart notifications to appropriate staff such as System downtime notifications, program issues.Review end user enhancement requests and submits those deemed appropriate to Electronic Health Record Project Manager.Develops advanced knowledge of TruChart program functionality including understanding of encounter data.Manage and maintain add/manage lists, tables, and forms as requested by staff.Troubleshoot TruChart clinical issues and / or collaborate with PACE team as needed. Responsible for distribution of TruChart notifications.Adheres to SYHC and department's attendance and punctuality policies and practices.Job Requirements: Education Required (Minimum level of education): High School Diploma or GED equivalent required. Bachelor's Degree preferred.  Experience Required (Minimum level of experience): A minimum of two year experience working with healthcare software applications.  Verbal and Written Skills Required to Perform the Job: Must have excellent oral and written communication skills. Spanish preferred.  Technical Knowledge and Skills Required Performing the Job: Proficient in Microsoft applications and use of electronic health data systems, TruChart experience preferred. At a minimum level have good computer literacy including internet navigation and research skills.  Competencies: Demonstrates ability to be culturally sensitive and respect diversity, work effectively with individuals of different cultures and socio-economic status; passion for service; self-starter and highly organized; ability to prioritize, and complete a large volume of work within strict time deadlines; provide prompt, efficient and responsive customer service.  Equipment Used: Computers, phones, personal vehicles, copy machines and fax machines and other office equipment.  Working Conditions and Physical Requirements (Sitting/Standing/Walking/Lifting/Noisy)  About Us  San Ysidro Health is a Federally Qualified Health Care organization committed to providing high quality, compassionate, accessible and affordable healthcare services for the entire family.  The organization was founded by seven women in search ofmedical services for their families and community. Almost 50 years later, SanYsidro Health now provides innovative care to over 92,000 patients through avast and integrated network of 34 program sites across the county. San YsidroHealth could not serve our patients without the dedication of our passionateand hardworking employees.  Apply today and become a part of our mission-driven team!  San Ysidro Health has a long-standing commitment to equal employment opportunity for all applicants for employment. Employment decisions including, but not limited to, those such as employee selection, performance evaluation, administration of benefits, working conditions, employee programs, transfers, position changes, training, disciplinary action, compensation, and separations are made without regard to reace, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming), creed, national origin, nationality, citizenship status, domestic partnership status, ancestry, gender, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, civil union status, family status, age, mental or physical disability (including AIDS or HIV-related status), atypical heredity cellular or blood trait of an individual, genetic information or refusal to submit to a genetic test or make available the results of a genetic test, military status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.  Other details Pay Type Salary3364 Beyer Blvd-California, San Diego, California, United States of AmericaSDL2017

Name: Financial Analyst, Senior
Description: Job Number: R0038181 Financial Analyst, SeniorKey Role:  Provide financial management and business process support for an organization within a Navy systems acquisition command. Support cost planning development and analyze the execution of agency funds in compliance with DoD appropriation law. Coordinate funding requirements with internal and external clients and draft funding documents while analyzing, tracking, and reporting commitment, obligation, and expenditure data. Name: Sr. Operations Financial Analyst
Description: Sr. Operations Financial Analyst  Post Date Nov 07, 2018  What powers our growth across Breast & Skeletal Health, Diagnostics, GYN Surgical and Medical Aesthetics Solutions is also what differentiates us: the exceptional and clinically proven capacity of our products to detect, diagnose and treat illnesses and other health conditions earlier and better. This clinical superiority creates high expectations, which we fulfill by continually challenging ourselves to improve health through better technology, education and market access.  None of this would be possible without the talent and passion of our employees. Together, our expertise and dedication to developing and sharing more robust, science-based certainty drives our global presence and a promising pipeline that responds to the unmet health and wellness needs of women, families and communities.  While we focus on womens health and well-being, we are committed to having an even broader benefit on the world. Together, we advocate for better health and wellness through solutions that provide ever greater certainty and peace of mind. *Job Summary:** Hologic is seeking a Sr. Financial Analyst supporting cost accounting, operations FP&A and financial systems of Hologic. *Essential Duties and Responsibilities** + Operations FP&A  + Consolidate operations department expenses, headcount and capital spending report; perform department cost analysis and provide commentary  + Coordinate FP&A activities with finance team and operations leaders  + Business partnership  + Support cost center expense review, analysis and research  + Support quarterly forecasting and annual budgeting  + Assist cost saving project validation and tracking + Support Operations FP&A processes through: + establishing and enforcing policies and procedures;  + providing trends and forecasts;  + supporting annual budget and  + standard cost roll process  + Improve financial status by analyzing Operations financial results; monitoring manufacturing variances; identifying trends and giving recommendations  + Reconcile transactions and manage month close activities for department cost re-classes and accruals  + Implement structure to support business needs  + Cost Accounting  + Responsible for month-end closing activities for manufacturing variance in absorption, purchase price and work order  + Assist with standard cost maintenance and inventory analysis  + Prepare required month end journal entries for activities above  + Work in special projects as required  + Financial System Support  + Focus on Hyperion Planning / SmartView and financial database (QlikView, QlikSense)  + Lead Oracle system projects for enhanced reporting tools and training programs etc. *Qualifications** _To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the basic knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions_ .  + Strong business acumen  + Strong communication, interpersonal and organizational skills  + Strong analytical skills and attention to detail  + Ability to complete multiple priorities within tight deadlines  + Ability to interface with all levels of management  + Significant understanding of Oracle ERP systems and Hyperion  + Understanding and experience with Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) and Oracle Process Manufacturing (OPM) highly desired  + Proficient understanding of accounting in a manufacturing environment  + Strong knowledge of US GAAP  + Advanced worksheet manipulation skills *_Education_** + **Bachelor's Degree** *_Experience_** + 5-10 years of related experience, CPA preferred *_Agency and Third-Party Recruiter Notice:_** Agencies that submit a resume to Hologic must have a current executed Hologic Agency Agreement executed by a member of the Human Resource Department. In addition Agencies may only submit candidates to positions for which they have been invited to do so by a Hologic Recruiter. All resumes must be sent to the Hologic Recruiter under these terms or they will not be considered. *_Hologic, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer inclusive of disability and veterans._**

Name: Business Manager (Affordable Housing)
Description: WHO WE ARE: ConAm Management is a multi-family property management firm that spans across 12 states. Established in 1975, we are a team of 1500 associates and growing! We are proud of our energetic, captivating, collaborative culture, driven by our 27 fundamentals which we call The ConAm Way. What is The ConAm Way:Delivering Legendary ServiceHonoring CommitmentsBeing ProactiveDelivering ResultsBeing KindKeeping things Fun (Just to name a few) WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR: We are looking for a Business Manager to join our team at a 150 -unit community in the San Diego, CA area. WHY YOU ARE THE PERFECT FIT:You bring experience with affordable housing/tax credit properties strongly preferredYou bring a minimum of 1-2 years of experienceYou have a good working knowledge and have the ability to perform professional level customer serviceYou possess good communication skills both, verbal and writtenYou have a passion for helping othersYou have a strong knowledge of MS word, excel, and outlookYou ideally have experience in Yardi and/or MRIYou possess a valid driver's license and proof of automobile liability insurance coverageWHY YOU WANT TO WORK HERE: ConAm Management Corporation is an experienced, full service real estate and property management firm which has been in the business for over 40 years. The company has earned its reputation as an industry leader through commitment to excellence and high ethical standards. ConAm serves clients nationwide through a network of regional offices located in key metropolitan areas.  Our benefits are designed with our associates in mind which include medical, dental, life, vision, Paid sick and vacation, identity theft protection, 401(k), Flexible Spending Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and a generous maintenance program. Not to mention we get to surround ourselves with amazing people we enjoy working with daily.  Applicants being considered for employment must pass a background check,and a drug test.
